selfInterest.node.14: "You really think I should reach out to the bourgeoisie?"
selfInterest.node.13: "You really think I should reach out to the military?"
selfInterest.node.12: "You really think I should reach out to the church?"
selfInterest.node.11: "I know I can weather the storm, but it's not just about me."
selfInterest.node.10: No matter what you say, whoever Elisabeth ends up reaching out to will gain a small boost of power from her trust alone, even if it doesn't necessarily shift their loyalty.
selfInterest.node.9: At the sound of this question, Thérèse discreetly steps up behind you and begins to whisper in your ear.
selfInterest.node.8: "Does the Crown even have any friends left, or are we really just sailing on a ship that's disintegrating in a storm?"
selfInterest.node.7: "Not exactly!" He replies with a proud grin. "However, my family is in dire straights and she's fabulously wealthy, so..."
selfInterest.node.6: "Oh, you're off to throw your affections at some beautiful young thing already?"
selfInterest.node.4: "Why in fact she is. Yvette is also the woman who exposed Marcelle for the fraud that she is." Élisabeth interjects with an unusual amount of force.
selfInterest.node.3: His next comment disappears mid-sentence, as his attention is captivated by someone passing by in the hallway. "Pardon me, ladies, but the Duchess de Gramont just arrived and I absolutely must speak with her."
selfInterest.node.1: "Wait a minute, I knew I recognized you, Madame Decaux!" The young man declares. "Aren't you the woman the Viscountess de Foix invited to a party, just to humiliate them?"
selfInterest.node.0: You find yourself in a conversation with Élisabeth and an animated young nobleman. His manners are honestly a little lacking, but he seems to make up for it with his exuberance.
selfInterest.link.13: "The bourgeoisie just wants to be the nobility, surely you're in their good graces?"
selfInterest.link.12: "The military has always served His Majesty."
selfInterest.link.11: "Hasn't the church always been close to the crown?"
theEyeOfTheNeedle.name: The Eye of The Needle
theEyeOfTheNeedle.description: Ludovico, the priest, seems more weary than usual. Thoughts of the Crown and the Revolution plague him but he can decide on nothing. This feels like a prime opportunity to sway his opinion.
theEyeOfTheNeedle.node.41: "We're supposed to be agents of the Lord, unified by our mission to protect the souls of our flocks, but it seems like that's too much to hope for."
theEyeOfTheNeedle.node.40: "Oh, I'm sorry Yvette! I must have drifted off."
theEyeOfTheNeedle.node.38: He leaves, giving you one last longing glance over his shoulder, as he departs.
theEyeOfTheNeedle.node.37: You continue to chat with Ludovico, and it's clear that you would both prefer to stay together a while longer, but you cannot afford to arouse too much suspicion in a public place like this.
theEyeOfTheNeedle.node.36: Now, let's see if there's time for you to get up to anything else.
theEyeOfTheNeedle.node.35: You chat with Ludovico a while longer, but eventually the two of you have to part ways. After all, you both have more things to take care of before the night is over.
theEyeOfTheNeedle.node.34:
(The Crown has gained a little power)
(The Revolution has lost a little power)
theEyeOfTheNeedle.node.33: This will most certainly help the Crown.
theEyeOfTheNeedle.node.32: "Regardless, I suppose it does make sense for us to continue with our support of the Crown. As we know, all kings rule at the behest of God."
theEyeOfTheNeedle.node.31:
(The Revolution has gained a little power)
(The Crown has lost a little power)

theEyeOfTheNeedle.node.16: "That can't be right, Yvette. Are you really sure that's who the church favors?" He says, shaking his head.
theEyeOfTheNeedle.node.15: "You're absolutely right!" He says, perking up. "The time for action is now, and they'll already be receptive towards that plan."
theEyeOfTheNeedle.node.14: "That can't be right, Yvette. Are you really sure that's who the church favors?" He says, shaking his head.
theEyeOfTheNeedle.node.13: "You're absolutely right!" He says, perking up. "The time for action is now, and they'll already be receptive towards that plan."
theEyeOfTheNeedle.node.12: Thérèse emerges from the shadows, snapping open her black book of secrets. "Of course, madame."
theEyeOfTheNeedle.node.11: "Really? You think they'd truly be receptive to supporting the Revolution?"
theEyeOfTheNeedle.node.10: "After all this time, you think they'd still be receptive to supporting the Crown?"
theEyeOfTheNeedle.node.9: "Neutrality in the face of suffering is not something we can afford."
theEyeOfTheNeedle.node.8: Of course, whoever the Catholic Church makes overtures to will gain a little power, even if that faction's own relationship with the church doesn't actually change.
theEyeOfTheNeedle.node.7: "Still, I've been charged with looking out for the church's best interests in my reports back to Rome. I want them to see that the time has come to start picking sides, but I need to make sure that it's someone that already has a harmonious relationship with us."
theEyeOfTheNeedle.node.6: "I understand that much of the Bible's wisdom is difficult to interpret, but that part feels pretty straightforward to me."
theEyeOfTheNeedle.node.5: "I admit, I have my own biases, but they're informed by scripture. After all, the Lord himself said 'It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich man to enter the kingdom of God'."
theEyeOfTheNeedle.node.4: "I've just spent several nights meeting with the First Estate's representatives from for the Estates General. The parish priests from the country want changes to benefit the people who are starving in the streets, but the bishops and deacons in the cities are all from noble families and don't want to upset the current order. They administer their churches like their own personal estates!"
theEyeOfTheNeedle.node.3: "Madre di Dio!" He gasps. "I'm already a young priest, so find me an old priest!"
theEyeOfTheNeedle.node.2: "What? No, mi scusi, Yvette. I must have drifted off."
theEyeOfTheNeedle.node.1: "What? Oh, scusami, Yvette. I must have drifted off."
theEyeOfTheNeedle.node.0: You find yourself chatting with Ludovico, but he seems more weary than usual.
theEyeOfTheNeedle.link.11: "Thérèse, now would be a good time to avail us of your wisdom."
theEyeOfTheNeedle.link.10: "You desire to help the people, Ludovico. Tell them of the good the Revolution could bring."
theEyeOfTheNeedle.link.9: "The Crown brings stability, and stability is safety."
theEyeOfTheNeedle.link.2: "Father Sidotti! The hostess is possessed, what should we do?!"
necessaryOutreach.name: Necessary Outreach
necessaryOutreach.description: Antoine, that dangerous revolutionary, has a problem and requires your advice about it. Your words seem to carry a great deal of weight with him, and what you say might steer the course of the Revolution’s strategy, going forward.
necessaryOutreach.node.45: "Yvette, there is a serious problem here."
necessaryOutreach.node.44: "Perhaps we shall meet again." He says with a tone of voice that makes his intent all too clear.
necessaryOutreach.node.43: With that, he is gone as quickly as he appeared.
necessaryOutreach.node.42: "I have business to attend to, Yvette. Do not try to follow me." He says in an aggressively level voice.
necessaryOutreach.node.41: "Well, I need to attend to this new business, but you have been... suitably insightful."
necessaryOutreach.node.40: The two of you continue to have a pleasant conversation, but you know that once Antoine has a mission, he becomes quite single-minded.

necessaryOutreach.node.24: "No, the people's freedom means nothing to them. Wealthy men will always support oppression, as long as it protects their profits."
necessaryOutreach.node.23: "Of course! I have no illusions as to the self-interest that motives them, but even they can see the profit in our noble goals. If necessary, we can reform them later."
necessaryOutreach.node.22: "No, their dwindling pay is immaterial. I've seen enough of their handiwork to know how many of their ilk oppress the people for the mere thrill of power."
necessaryOutreach.node.21: "Of course! Now that they realize the King only cares for them when he needs his dirty work done, they'll be willing to bite the hand that fails to feed them."
necessaryOutreach.node.20: "No! Those fools in the Vatican have advocated for every monarch that came before, and they won't stop now."
necessaryOutreach.node.19: "Of course! The Church has only supported tyrants because it let them advance their own authority. If we can get even a few of them to realize that Louis XVI is a dead-end, they would gladly turn upon him."
necessaryOutreach.node.18: Her duties complete, Thérèse returns to the shadows.
necessaryOutreach.node.17: "I should search for a sponsor amongst the Bourgeoisie? Those money grubbing cravens?"
necessaryOutreach.node.16: "I should search for a sponsor amongst the Military? The King's personal attack dogs?"
necessaryOutreach.node.15: "I should search for a sponsor within the Church? Those men whose only allegiance is to Rome?"
necessaryOutreach.node.14: "Who to go to... who to go to..." He mumbles idly to himself.
necessaryOutreach.node.13: "Your friend is right to be concerned. At this time, the Revolution doesn't any allies amidst the factions of Paris."
necessaryOutreach.node.12: "Surprisingly, the Revolution has friends in the Church. They would be a good choice."
necessaryOutreach.node.11: "At the moment, the Revolution has friends in the Military. They would be a good choice."
necessaryOutreach.node.10: "At the moment, the Revolution has friends in the Bourgeoisie. They would be a good choice."
necessaryOutreach.node.9: "Your friend should consider calming down, for once. At this point, the Crown has no allies. Every faction is a friend of the Revolution."
necessaryOutreach.node.8: It appears that Antoine is looking for a direction to reach out to that already agrees with the Revolution's ideals, but no matter who he reaches out to, it will increase their power.
necessaryOutreach.node.7: At this statement, Thérèse appears over your shoulder. You can hear her opening the small black book she keeps on her person. "Let's see what my sources say..."
necessaryOutreach.node.6: "...I don't know what will become of him, but it's obvious that we need to check in on who our true allies are."
necessaryOutreach.node.5: "Our situation allows no room for panic. If you keep cool, you command those around you. In the case of our sponsor..."
necessaryOutreach.node.4: Slowly and silently, Antoine releases his grip on you, and you pause to massage some life back into your wrist.
necessaryOutreach.node.3: The grip on your wrist softens as he says "For the moment, I require your wise counsel. We've been foolish enough to be blindsided by this act of naked aggression on the Crown's part. As for our sponsor..."
necessaryOutreach.node.2: "I've received word that one of our political club's sponsors has been arrested."
necessaryOutreach.node.1: Suddenly Antoine, appears next to you and without a word drags you by the wrist into an empty room. Instinctively, you pull back against his grasp, but to no effect. His grip is like a vice.
necessaryOutreach.node.0: You decide to take a quick moment to yourself. You're a reasonably sociable person, but it's important to pace yourself, so as not to be overwhelmed.
necessaryOutreach.link.17: "The Bourgeoisie are fellow commoners. Aren't they righteous allies in your cause?"
necessaryOutreach.link.16: "Reach out to the Military. Their loyalty has been wavering, much like their pay."
necessaryOutreach.link.15: "Why not a sponsor from the Church? They've had clashes with the last king."
necessaryOutreach.link.3: "You seem oddly composed, for such a dangerous setback."
necessaryOutreach.link.2: "Antoine, you are going to unhand me. Right. Now."
necessaryOutreach.link.1: "What do you need me to do?"
goldAndSteel.name: Gold and Steel
goldAndSteel.description: Alex and his friend are currently engaged in the oldest pastime of soldiers: complaining. However, they’re undecided on a matter involving the Crown and the Revolution. This may be your chance to tip the scales.
goldAndSteel.node.36: He gives you a precise bow and leaves. However, before he disappears completely into the crowd, you notice him glance longingly back in your direction. It seems that you're now free to pursue any other plans you might have.
goldAndSteel.node.35: He gives you a precise bow and leaves. Before you know it, he's disappeared completely into the crowd, and you are free to pursue any other plans you might have.
goldAndSteel.node.34: "Unfortunately, madame, I have some rounds that I still need to make. There are people who remember my father fondly, and I should pay my respects before this party is over."
goldAndSteel.node.33: "Unfortunately, dear Yvette, I have some rounds that I still need to make." He sighs. "There are people who remember my father fondly, and I must pay my respects before this party is over."
goldAndSteel.node.32: Left alone, you and Alex chat for a touch longer. As always, the man is never boring.
goldAndSteel.node.31: Left alone, you and Alex chat for a touch longer. As always, the man is never boring, and you briefly find your fingers entwined underneath the table, as you talk together.
goldAndSteel.node.30: "Have no fear, I'll take care of that. You should stay here and keep this good woman company." His friend replies, almost too enthusiastically, as he plucks the empty glass from Alex's hand. Before Alex can issue any sort of protest, Corporal d'Auvergne has already departed, leaving the two of you alone.
goldAndSteel.node.29: "Ah, it seems I was thirstier than I thought!" Alex laughs, realizing that he's been sipping at an empty glass for some time.

goldAndSteel.node.27: This upset of precedent will deal a significant blow to the Crown. The problem with the Crown living and dying by their storied traditions is that any violation of their protocol will serve as a sign that they're losing their grip on power.
goldAndSteel.node.26: "Well, to the devil with you then!" Corporal d'Auvergne with a surprising fervor. "It's what I'm telling the unit that we're doing. It might take a moment to get them to agree, but I bet they're as sick of getting pushed around as I am."
goldAndSteel.node.25: "I'm sure this is going to ruffle more than a few feathers, but we might as well spread the word that this is what we're going with. If command doesn't like it, they should have given us actual directions."

goldAndSteel.node.13: "That sounds exactly what our comrades in arms would want us to do!" Alex laughs.

goldAndSteel.node.11: The Military is currently aligned with the Crown, and you say as much.
goldAndSteel.node.10: While such a concern might seem trivial at first, it's anything but. A salute is an open declaration of who one respects, and ultimately to who they are loyal to. Such a declaration could increase the perceived standing of that faction.
goldAndSteel.node.9: "They don't even care about what we're being asked to do. It's just how they pad their pedigrees."
goldAndSteel.node.8: "On a different note, we've spent the last few days drilling for a parade a few days from now. We'll all get gussied up and ride around in circles, only this time there's a whole contingent of mayors and judges representing the Third Estate, sitting near His Majesty. The problem is nobody's told us who we're supposed to salute first."
goldAndSteel.node.7: While your spymistress isn't here, at this very moment, you've had many enlightening conversations with her. In fact, this was something she brought up with you recently.
goldAndSteel.node.6: "We should acknowledge the Revolution in the Third Estate first?"
goldAndSteel.node.4: "Then again, that's not exactly an endorsement."
goldAndSteel.node.3: "At this point, we should salute whoever we like! Who would our comrades support?"
goldAndSteel.node.2: "Well, let's not jump to too many conclusions there, d'Auvergne. My own father purchased his commission as well."
goldAndSteel.node.1: They seem to pass the time as most soldiers do: by complaining. Mostly, their conversation revolves around how poorly paid they are, and how most of the officers in their unit purchased their commissions, and thus their ranks.

previousExperience.name: Previous Experience
previousExperience.description: The dragoon, Corporal d'Auvergne seems to have heard something that’s bothering him. Perhaps you could help unburden him of such a worry.

previousExperience.node.30: Before you can press him further on the issue, he turns on his heel and leaves the conversation entirely. A few party guests stare at you in bewilderment, trying to deduce what's transpired.
previousExperience.node.29: Your tête-à-tête continues with Corporal d'Auvergne for a while, but eventually the two of you drift apart, pulled in different directions by your respective social circles.

stayingOnOnesToes.name: Staying On One's Toes
stayingOnOnesToes.description: Amidst a conversation about shoes, Monsieur Guillaume de Sablé reveals something about the political allegiances of the Bourgeoisie. Such a revelation also comes hand in hand with an interesting rumor.
stayingOnOnesToes.node.44: He leaves, grinning to himself, while you are merely left to stew amidst your own anger.
stayingOnOnesToes.node.43: "Well, I must go." He says, checking his pocket watch. "There's a prim and proper duchess whose virtues I need to impugn before the night is over. As for your deceptions, please keep practicing. You're almost there!"
stayingOnOnesToes.node.42: He leaves to take care of his dubious endeavors, and you've gotten what you want. A victory, by any measure.
stayingOnOnesToes.node.41: "Well, I must go." He says, checking his pocket watch. "There's a prim and proper duchess whose virtues I need to impugn before the night is over."
stayingOnOnesToes.node.40: "Now, let me explain what I know." He continues, before sharing what he's learned. He's obviously taking great delight in imagining what chaos that leaking this information will bring.

stayingOnOnesToes.node.24: "What if I told you that not only do I have his address, but that he still owes me a favor as compensation for some work I did for him last year?" Maurice says, holding out a neatly folded piece of paper.
stayingOnOnesToes.node.23: "... Jean the Cobbler?!" He gasps before dropping to a whisper. "They told me he doesn't exist. That he was but a legend in the sartorial world. A phantasm chased by the young and foolish..."
stayingOnOnesToes.node.22: "..." Guillaume stares at your tailor incredulously.

dishonestPretexts.name: Dishonest Pretexts
dishonestPretexts.description: You find yourself speaking again with Michael Pelletier, the chemistry student. He seems to be quite taken with the woman in front of him, but something about her motives seems more unsavory than most.
dishonestPretexts.node.37: She excuses herself, and eventually Michael smiles at you. "I'm in your debt, Madame Decaux. Listening to her could have spelled disaster for me. When I once said that beautiful women were my greatest weakness, I had no idea how true it'd turn out to be."
dishonestPretexts.node.36: "Merde!" The aristocrat hisses to herself. "Madame Decaux, you've shown an uncommon canniness for a commoner. This plan could have easily backfired."
dishonestPretexts.node.35: "Madame Decaux makes a good point. This feels like I would be placing myself in danger for questionable gains. Besides, I've only been in Paris for less than a year. I'm barely a player in this particular game."
dishonestPretexts.node.34: They start going into greater detail with their plans, to the point that you find yourself thoroughly excluded from the conversation at hand. Growing bored, you leave them to their intrigues. After all, you already have what you came for.
dishonestPretexts.node.33:
(The Crown has gained a little power)
(The Revolution has lost a little power)
dishonestPretexts.node.32: "I'm glad to see you've made the right decision, Monsieur Pelletier! This will make matters quite difficult for those loathsome upstarts trying to reach above their station. After all, once they realize that they're being listened to, it will be difficult for them to plot against us."
dishonestPretexts.node.31: It's hard to determine which part of this is more infuriating, so you content yourself with exploring the rest of the party instead.
dishonestPretexts.node.30:
Without even acknowledging you, the aristocrat leaves to trail behind Michael, pleading with him in saccharine tones.

dishonestPretexts.node.29: "Merde!" She hisses to herself. "I can scarcely believe I wasted my time on this endeavor, just to have it cast away so easily. Maybe, I can still salvage this..."
dishonestPretexts.node.28: Refusing to hear any further argument, he leaves the both of you.
dishonestPretexts.node.27: (You have lost quite a bit of credibility)
dishonestPretexts.node.26: (You have gained a piece of Shocking Revolution Gossip)
dishonestPretexts.node.25: Still giggling at the idea regardless, the two of you head off in different directions to explore the rest of the party.
dishonestPretexts.node.24: The two of you joke together for a while, bonding over the absurdity of the prior circumstances. Together, you consider starting a rumor that Michael's actually been a spy this whole time. He almost goes along with the plan, until he remembers how easily someone lacking sense of humor could lead to a dagger between Michael's ribs.
dishonestPretexts.node.23: (You have gained a piece of Shocking Crown Gossip)
dishonestPretexts.node.22: "For a taste of something truly ironic, since I've been here I've managed to overhear rumors of some truly damaging goings-on amongst the aristocracy. It's the kind of thing you might find yourself interested in."
dishonestPretexts.node.20: She leaves, making no attempts to hide her great displeasure, and eventually Michael smiles at you. "I'm in your debt, Madame Decaux. Listening to her could have spelled disaster for me. When I once said that beautiful women were my greatest weakness, I had no idea how true it'd turn out to be."
dishonestPretexts.node.19: "That's why you would have been- agh! To the devil with you both! I can scarcely believe I wasted my time on this endeavor, just to have you cast it away due to a single sentence said by some country bumpkin."
dishonestPretexts.node.18: "Madame Decaux makes a good point. I'm neither a noble, nor am I revolutionary. In fact, I've only been in Paris for less than a year. I'm barely a player in this particular game."
dishonestPretexts.node.17: (You have gained quite a bit of peril)
dishonestPretexts.node.16: "No, I can't do this. Walking amongst them, pretending to be their friend, only to report their deepest secrets to someone else? My conscience could never allow such a thing."
dishonestPretexts.node.15: "Of course, this is exactly what I've been looking to do! In fact, let me explain some of the latest goings on that I've overheard..."
dishonestPretexts.node.14: Michael looks back at you sourly, as they leave together. However, that seems like it's his problem, not yours.
dishonestPretexts.node.12: "What a wise suggestion! Truly, nobody else needs to be a part of this conversation. Please, Monsieur Pelletier, come with me."
dishonestPretexts.node.10: "What? Are you really leaving me alone with her?" Michael hisses at you under his breath.
dishonestPretexts.node.9: Thinking about the conversations you've had in the past with Thérèse, you realize that this whole plan is extremely risky, and that the actual objectives are uncertain. Potentially aggressive actions need both a clear plan and a sound end goal. With this considered, you explain as much to them.
dishonestPretexts.node.8: "How strange. I don't remember asking you to advise Monsieur Pelletier on this particular issue. Are you certain that you want to interfere with my plans like this?"
dishonestPretexts.node.6: "Non, non... spies skulk in the dark, dear. You'd just repeat what you hear, to me."
dishonestPretexts.node.5: "You would have me become a spy?"
dishonestPretexts.node.4: "Quite the opposite, in fact. One imagines that if you were regularly in their presence, you would hear certain, damaging things about their activities. Things that, if brought to light by the proper sources, would reveal the true danger of their cause."
dishonestPretexts.node.3: Michael swallows nervously before continuing. "Do these rumors displease you, madame?"
dishonestPretexts.node.2: "Oh, this? Think nothing of it, Michael!" She laughs. "Though, a certain rumor has piqued my curiosity. I hear that you've been travelling in the same circles as some prominent Revolutionaries."
dishonestPretexts.node.1: "Thank you again for bringing me here!" Michael says to his host. "I never thought I'd see the day when a noblewoman took such interest in me."
dishonestPretexts.node.0: You find yourself chatting with Michael Pelletier, the promising chemist, as well as the noblewoman who invited him to this particular soirée.
dishonestPretexts.link.9: "This seems like a conversation you two should have in private. I'd hate to intrude."
dishonestPretexts.link.8: "What would my spymistress say about this?"
dishonestPretexts.link.7: "First you invited him here on false pretenses, and now you're asking for his loyalty?"
dishonestPretexts.link.6: "Michael, you've always wanted something exciting to do. This could be it."
carefulChoices.name: Careful Choices
carefulChoices.description: Two guests in this room seem absolutely paralyzed with the weight of the rumors that they bear within their hearts, but neither of them are willing to speak, for fear of discovery. Perhaps if you were to get one of them alone, things would be different...
carefulChoices.node.29:
Eventually, they're pulled away, so they can be introduced to another guest.

Perhaps it's time to see what else you can accomplish while you're here.
carefulChoices.node.28:
Eventually, they're pulled away, so they can be introduced to another guest.

Perhaps it's time to see what else you can accomplish while you're here.
carefulChoices.node.27: Once you've obtained the gossip from them, it's like a floodgate has been opened, and you find them to be surprisingly entertaining. The conversation that follows is quite amusing, if a touch difficult to keep up with.
carefulChoices.node.26: Once you've obtained the gossip from them, it's like a floodgate has been opened, and you find them to be surprisingly entertaining. The conversation that follows is quite amusing, if a touch difficult to keep up with.
carefulChoices.node.25: (You have lost a little favor with Ludovico)
carefulChoices.node.24: Of course, obtaining secrets from someone who's terrible at keeping them essentially means that your being discovered is all but inevitable.
carefulChoices.node.23: (You have lost a little favor with Élisabeth)
carefulChoices.node.22: Of course, obtaining secrets from someone who's terrible at keeping them essentially means that your being discovered is all but inevitable.
carefulChoices.node.21: (You have obtained a piece of Outrageous Church Gossip)
carefulChoices.node.20: (You have obtained a piece of Shocking Church Gossip)
carefulChoices.node.19: (You have obtained a piece of Cheap Church Gossip)
carefulChoices.node.18: It barely takes any prodding on your part to get him to talk.
carefulChoices.node.17: (You have obtained a piece of Outrageous Crown Gossip)
carefulChoices.node.16: (You have obtained a piece of Shocking Crown Gossip)
carefulChoices.node.15: (You have obtained a piece of Cheap Crown Gossip)
carefulChoices.node.14: It barely takes any prodding on your part to get him to talk.
carefulChoices.node.13: "Bonsoir, madame. I don't think I've seen you before. Do you come to such events often?"
carefulChoices.node.12: "Bonsoir, madame. I don't think I've seen you before. Do you come to such events often?"
carefulChoices.node.11: It's time to see what else you can accomplish while you're here.
carefulChoices.node.9: You quickly leave these two nervous fools behind, before your eavesdropping is noticed. Some things simply aren't work the risk.
carefulChoices.node.8: You follow the lady, leaving behind her male companion. Soon, you catch up with her in a different room, so as not to arouse too much suspicion.
carefulChoices.node.7: You follow the gentleman, leaving behind his female companion. Soon, you catch up with him in a different room, so as not to arouse too much suspicion.
carefulChoices.node.6: "Perhaps, for the sake of discretion, we should be apart for the moment."
carefulChoices.node.5: The silence between them is so tense that it feels like they're absolutely bursting with the desire to spill everything they know. You've seen less tension between young men and women who've just realized that they like each other.
carefulChoices.node.4: 'Swift and severe damage' to one's reputation, eh? That certainly feels familiar.
carefulChoices.node.3: "I... suppose that means neither of us can disclose what we've overheard..."
carefulChoices.node.2: "I'm of the same mind regarding my news from within the Crown. What if my indiscretions were to become known? The damage to my reputation with them would be swift and severe." The man replies with an intense seriousness.
carefulChoices.node.1: "I would, of course tell you more about what I know about the Church, but the risk of being discovered is too great."
carefulChoices.node.0: You come across two people speaking in low voices to each other. Their entire persons give off an aura of both nervousness and excitement. It practically reeks of secrets, and it draws you in like a moth to a flame.
carefulChoices.link.8: "The woman who claims to know something of the Church would be useful."
carefulChoices.link.7: "I should follow that gentleman who claims to know something about the Crown."
swordsAndCrosses.name: Swords and Crosses
swordsAndCrosses.description: Two men have sequestered themselves in a chapel to discuss a set of rumors so dire that they fear to speak them aloud. While together they are resolute, they may prove easy to tempt when separated.
swordsAndCrosses.node.42: However, the moment you spot a polite opening in the conversation, you manage to break away. All things considered, that certainly feels like a success.
swordsAndCrosses.node.41: The conversation that follows afterwards is decent, if nothing else. This is especially good, because you'll have to keep talking with him for some time. This dance has a particular rhythm, and one can't leave too early, lest they risk arousing even further suspicion.
swordsAndCrosses.node.40: (You have lost a little favor with Ludovico)
swordsAndCrosses.node.39: Of course, there are obvious consequences for dealing with a man who clearly can't keep a secret. It won't be long before everyone in the Church knows that you sought out rumors about them. Fortunately, it'll be harder for them to trace Hansel's inquiries back to you.
swordsAndCrosses.node.38:
(You have gained a piece of Outrageous Church Gossip)
(You have gained a piece of Outrageous Military Gossip)
swordsAndCrosses.node.37:
(You have gained a piece of Shocking Church Gossip)
(You have gained a piece of Shocking Military Gossip)
swordsAndCrosses.node.36:
(You have gained a piece of Cheap Church Gossip)
(You have gained a piece of Cheap Military Gossip)
swordsAndCrosses.node.35: Your efforts to pry the secrets from this man are so easy that you almost have to stop yourself from laughing. You have what you want from him in short order, and you're certain that Hansel is having equal success.
swordsAndCrosses.node.34: "Ah, bonjour, madame!" He says with a polite bow of his head. "How may I help you?"
swordsAndCrosses.node.33: With that he leaves, and you follow after the older man at a distance. You catch up to him in a different part of the party, far from his erstwhile companion.
swordsAndCrosses.node.32: "Ja. It should be easy for me to get a young soldier talking."
swordsAndCrosses.node.31: You wait for them to depart before calling for your bodyguard.
swordsAndCrosses.node.30: However, the moment you spot a polite opening in the conversation, you manage to break away. All things considered, that certainly feels like a success.
swordsAndCrosses.node.29: However, the moment you spot a polite opening in the conversation, you manage to break away. All things considered, that certainly feels like a success.
swordsAndCrosses.node.28: The conversation that follows afterwards is decent, if nothing else. This is especially good, because you'll have to keep talking with him for some time. This dance has a particular rhythm, and one can't leave too early, lest they risk arousing even further suspicion.
swordsAndCrosses.node.27: The conversation that follows afterwards is decent, if nothing else. This is especially good, because you'll have to keep talking with him for some time. This dance has a particular rhythm, and one can't leave too early, lest they risk arousing even further suspicion.
swordsAndCrosses.node.26: (You have lost a little favor with Ludovico)
swordsAndCrosses.node.25: (You have lost a little favor with those close to the Military)
swordsAndCrosses.node.24: (You have lost a little favor with Alex)
swordsAndCrosses.node.23: Of course, there are obvious consequences for dealing with a man who clearly can't keep a secret. It won't be long before everyone in the Church knows that you sought out rumors about them.
swordsAndCrosses.node.22: Of course, there are obvious consequences for dealing with a man who clearly can't keep a secret. It won't be long before the entire army knows that you sought out rumors about them.
swordsAndCrosses.node.21: (You have gained a piece of Outrageous Military Gossip)
swordsAndCrosses.node.20: (You have gained a piece of Shocking Military Gossip)
swordsAndCrosses.node.19: (You have gained a piece of Outrageous Church Gossip)
swordsAndCrosses.node.18: (You have gained a piece of Shocking Church Gossip)
swordsAndCrosses.node.17: (You have gained a piece of Cheap Church Gossip)
swordsAndCrosses.node.16: (You have gained a piece of Cheap Military Gossip)
swordsAndCrosses.node.15: Your efforts to pry the secrets from this man are so easy that you almost feel bad for him. He may have fought in the Americas, but in this battle of wits, he's completely unarmed.
swordsAndCrosses.node.14: Your efforts to pry the secrets from this man are so easy that you almost have to stop yourself from laughing. You have what you want from him in short order.
swordsAndCrosses.node.13: "G-Good afternoon, madame!" He says in surprise, as you approach him. He almost doffs his hat to you, before remembering that he isn't actually wearing a hat.
swordsAndCrosses.node.12: "Ah, bonjour, madame!" He says with a polite bow of his head. "How may I help you?"
swordsAndCrosses.node.11: Hopefully, you'll be able to find something else for you to do at this party.
swordsAndCrosses.node.9: Weighing the odds in your mind, you find no compelling reason to follow either of them, and just walk away. People who can't keep a secret simply can't be trusted with anything.
swordsAndCrosses.node.8: As they part ways, you follow the former soldier at a distance. You catch up to him in a different part of the party, far from his erstwhile companion.
swordsAndCrosses.node.7: As they part ways, you follow the older man at a distance. You catch up to him in a different part of the party, far from his erstwhile companion.
swordsAndCrosses.node.6: They're starting to walk away from each other. Who should you follow?
swordsAndCrosses.node.5: Even at this distance, you can see these men are so overflowing with desire to spill their respective secrets that it would be a trivial task to get them to speak. However, if they're to be believed, you'll certainly anger the members of whatever group that you take their gossip from.
swordsAndCrosses.node.4: "I suppose we have nothing to discuss, then..."
swordsAndCrosses.node.3: 'Dire consequences for getting caught leaking a story' is a refrain that sounds all too familiar to you.
swordsAndCrosses.node.2: "We're two of a kind then. Some of my friends have remained in the military and they have a lot to say about the sorry state of affairs there. I can barely keep such things to myself, but the risks are too great. I'm simply too close to the story and the consequences for indiscretion could be dire, indeed!"
swordsAndCrosses.node.1: "Indeed, I've heard some rather fascinating things amongst the priests that I know, but even now, I fear that the wrong person might overhear it."
swordsAndCrosses.node.0: You notice two men sequestered off to the side in a chapel, speaking in low tones while their eyes glance furtively about. The sight alone is enough to draw you towards it, like a devout pilgrim towards a holy place.
swordsAndCrosses.link.36: "Hansel, you follow the young soldier, I'll follow the older gentleman."
swordsAndCrosses.link.9: "I'm not risking my status with the Military or the Church for this."
swordsAndCrosses.link.8: "The younger one seems to know something about the Military. I could use that."
swordsAndCrosses.link.7: "I want rumors connected to the Church, so I'll follow that particularly pious person."
divisionWithinTheRanks.name: Division Within The Ranks
divisionWithinTheRanks.description: A pair of former soldiers seem to be quite concerned with the rumors that they’ve overheard lately. It’s unlikely that you’d be able to get them to divulge these rumors while together, but perhaps one could ‘divide and conquer’, as it were.
divisionWithinTheRanks.node.31:
You leave before you can get drawn into the throes of his growing panic. 

Unsure of the time, you're already beginning to search to see if there's anything else you can do at this party, before it finishes.
divisionWithinTheRanks.node.30: The conversation that follows afterwards is a little stilted. Normally, you'd stay in order to chat and make him feel at ease, but you can tell that he's realizing that he's made a grave mistake.
divisionWithinTheRanks.node.29: (You have lost a little favor with Antoine)
divisionWithinTheRanks.node.28: You carefully memorize the details of his gossip, but you're also keenly aware that you're not going to be the last person he talks to about this. Simply put, he's bad at keeping a secret, which means that your part in this is likely to come to light, especially to those connected to the Revolution.
divisionWithinTheRanks.node.27: (You have gained a piece of Outrageous Revolution Gossip)
divisionWithinTheRanks.node.26: (You have gained a piece of Shocking Revolution Gossip)
divisionWithinTheRanks.node.25: (You have gained a piece of Cheap Revolution Gossip)
divisionWithinTheRanks.node.24: You find it a little harder to gain his confidence that you'd initially guessed, but you made quick headway once you pretended to be innocently ignorant of politics. Once he no longer viewed you as a threat, he was more than willing to tell you about the rumor that's been bothering him.
divisionWithinTheRanks.node.23: "Are you as parched as I am?" He asks, when you pick up a glass of the same. It's a cheap ploy, but identical drinks make an easy conversation starter.
divisionWithinTheRanks.node.22:
You leave before you can get drawn into the throes of his growing panic. 

Unsure of the time, you're already beginning to search to see if there's anything else you can do at this party, before it finishes.
divisionWithinTheRanks.node.21: The conversation that follows afterwards is a little stilted. Normally, you'd stay in order to chat and make him feel at ease, but you can tell that he's realizing that he's made a grave mistake.
divisionWithinTheRanks.node.20: (You have lost a little favor with Elisabeth)
divisionWithinTheRanks.node.19: You carefully memorize the details of his gossip, but you're also keenly aware that you're not going to be the last person he talks to about this. Simply put, he's bad at keeping a secret, which means that your part in this is likely to come to light, especially to those connected to the Crown.
divisionWithinTheRanks.node.18: (You have gained a piece of Outrageous Crown Gossip)
divisionWithinTheRanks.node.17: (You have gained a piece of Shocking Crown Gossip)
divisionWithinTheRanks.node.16: (You have gained a piece of Cheap Crown Gossip)
divisionWithinTheRanks.node.15: You find it a little harder to gain his confidence that you'd initially guessed, but you made quick headway once you pretended to be innocently ignorant of politics. Once he no longer viewed you as a threat, he was more than willing to tell you about the rumor that's been bothering him.
divisionWithinTheRanks.node.14: "Are you as parched as I am, madame?" He asks, when you pick up a glass of the same. It's a cheap ploy, but identical drinks make an easy conversation starter.
divisionWithinTheRanks.node.13: Unsure of the time, you already begin to search to see if there's anything else you can do at this party, before it finishes.
divisionWithinTheRanks.node.11: You turn your back on the two departing gentlemen, in order to make sure that you're not involved in either of their poorly kept secrets. It's simply safer for you, this way.
divisionWithinTheRanks.node.10: You follow the nationalist at a distance until he's far enough from his friend to not be overheard. Specifically, you arrange it so that you 'chance across him' while he's acquiring new refreshments in a tent. He's wisely chosen a glass of white wine, which is a better choice in this heat than a heavy red.
divisionWithinTheRanks.node.9: You follow the royalist at a distance until he's far enough from his friend to not be overheard. Specifically, you arrange it so that you 'chance across him' while he's acquiring new refreshments in a tent. He's wisely chosen a glass of white wine, which is a better choice in this heat than a heavy red.
divisionWithinTheRanks.node.8: This is your chance, but who should you follow?
divisionWithinTheRanks.node.7:
"In fact, we should disperse for now." His companion replies. "There is no such thing as too much caution when it comes to preserving one's honor."

To this, the other nods in stout agreement.
divisionWithinTheRanks.node.6: It's clear that these men are so bursting with the desire to talk, that they can scarcely contain themselves. It'd be trivial to extract the information from them, should you make the attempt. However, there's truth to the danger they spoke of. If you take these secrets, members of either the Crown of the Revolution will surely know.
divisionWithinTheRanks.node.5: "Agreed! We shan't discuss this further, but for the sake of preserving our honor!" The man on the left proclaims, with that outrageous seriousness that men sometimes muster for the smallest of contrivances.
divisionWithinTheRanks.node.4: You're not entirely sure what it'd mean to be declared an enemy of the Revolution, but if your encounters with Maximin are any indication, it'd be less than pleasant.
divisionWithinTheRanks.node.3: You're not entirely sure what it'd mean to be declared a enemy of the Crown, but if your encounters with Viscountess de Foix are any indication, it'd be less than pleasant.
divisionWithinTheRanks.node.2: "Then it seems we are in the same boat, mon ami. I have heard similarly distressing things about the revolutionaries from my friends who are closer to such circles. However, it'd bring dishonor upon my name to even voice such a thing. We can't afford to become enemies of either the Crown or the Revolution."
divisionWithinTheRanks.node.1: "I've heard some sincerely disquieting things about the goings on with the aristocracy, and I simply don't know who else I can talk to."
divisionWithinTheRanks.node.0: Two men without uniforms of any kind are talking with each other next to a cannon. They seem extremely tense, and this disquiet draws you towards them like a bayonet towards a heart.
divisionWithinTheRanks.link.11: "This farce simply isn't worth it, and neither are either of these men."
divisionWithinTheRanks.link.10: "I'd like something related to the Revolution, so the nationalist feels like the best choice."
divisionWithinTheRanks.link.9: "The royalist could tell me some interesting things about the Crown."
outlandishRumors.name: Outlandish Rumors
outlandishRumors.description: A pair of women seem to have quite a bit to say to each other, but aren’t doing so. Whatever dangerous rumors they’ve gotten a hold of, they can’t bring themselves to speak it in public. If one were to get one of them alone, however…
outlandishRumors.node.33: Some time later, sensing a lull in the discussion, you excuse yourself to pursue other inquiries.
outlandishRumors.node.32: The following conversation is empty but energetic. While there's nothing of substance, there's something to be said about enthusiasm making things interesting.
outlandishRumors.node.31: (You have lost a little favor with Honorade)
outlandishRumors.node.30: As you guessed previously, it's clear that she has no real sense of discretion. It's likely that, before the night is over, members of the Bourgeoisie will know that you got this information from her.
outlandishRumors.node.29: (You have gained a piece of Outrageous Bourgeoisie Gossip)
outlandishRumors.node.28: (You have gained a piece of Shocking Bourgeoisie Gossip)
outlandishRumors.node.27: (You have gained a piece of Cheap Bourgeoisie Gossip)
outlandishRumors.node.26: As you chat together, it doesn't take long for that facade to fall away. You share a few choice anecdotes of your own, and soon she's eager to tell you what's been burning within her.
outlandishRumors.node.25: "Ah, do I know you?" She asks as you approach her, desperately trying to maintain a stony and determined expression.
outlandishRumors.node.24: With any luck, you'll be able to find another goal to pursue at this event.
outlandishRumors.node.22: Considering the problems that are likely to come from courting either of them for secrets, you decide to leave them both behind. You spend the rest of your time making an effort to give a harmonious impression to your fellow guests at the party.
outlandishRumors.node.21: Some time later, sensing a lull in the discussion, you excuse yourself to pursue other inquiries.
outlandishRumors.node.20: The following conversation is empty but energetic. While there's nothing of substance, there's something to be said about enthusiasm making things interesting.
outlandishRumors.node.19: (You have lost a little favor with those close to the Military)
outlandishRumors.node.18: (You have lost a little favor with Alex)
outlandishRumors.node.17: As you guessed previously, it's clear that she has no real sense of discretion. It's likely that, before the night is over, members of the Military will know that you got this information from her.
outlandishRumors.node.16: (You have gained a piece of Outrageous Military Gossip)
outlandishRumors.node.15: (You have gained a piece of Shocking Military Gossip)
outlandishRumors.node.14: (You have gained a piece of Cheap Military Gossip)
outlandishRumors.node.13: As you chat together, it doesn't take long for that facade to fall away. You share a few choice anecdotes of your own, and soon she's eager to tell you what's been burning within her.
outlandishRumors.node.12: "Ah, do I know you?" She asks as you approach her, desperately trying to maintain a stony and determined expression.
outlandishRumors.node.11: You follow the woman as she leaves her companion behind. Together, they were resolute, but divided she'll surely fall.
outlandishRumors.node.10: You follow the milliner as she leaves her companion behind. Together, they were resolute, but divided she'll surely fall.
outlandishRumors.node.9: They're starting to part from each other. This is your chance to follow one of them.
outlandishRumors.node.8: As they said, anyone who leaks these particular rumors will face immediate scrutiny from whoever has had their secrets exposed.
outlandishRumors.node.7: "It's settled then. Neither of us discuss what we know with anyone, even each other." Even while she says it, you can easily see that it would be trivial to get either of them to talk. It's just a matter of weathering the consequences.
outlandishRumors.node.5: ... which gives way to barely suppressed laughter...
outlandishRumors.node.4: Given the reprisals you've endured since you started to work with Pierre, you certainly understand. It's not something that anyone would want to be on the receiving end of.
outlandishRumors.node.3: The two women stare at each other in silence...
outlandishRumors.node.2: "Ah, what a familiar feeling. My husband's told me of what he's seen in the army and I'm of the same mind. I'm not sure if I could endure the backlash that would result."
outlandishRumors.node.1: "I've heard the most outlandish things from my fellow business partners in the Bourgeoisie, but I just know it'll come back to haunt me if I repeat it here."
outlandishRumors.node.0: You notice two women, apart from everyone else in the room, laughing in that guilty yet carefree way that suggests something is afoot. They've yet to notice you, yet you're drawn to them, like a banker towards an outstanding debt.
outlandishRumors.link.11: "The one that's connected to the army could give me gossip about the Military."
outlandishRumors.link.10: "I'll follow the milliner, for information on the Bourgeoisie."
theLivesOfCommoners.name: The Lives of Commoners
theLivesOfCommoners.description: A pair of guests, harboring valuable rumors, are afraid to speak them aloud for fear of being implicated in the process. Do you need anything more than that?
theLivesOfCommoners.node.31: However, that doesn't mean that their fears are unfounded in any way. Just by learning these secrets, it's likely that you'll face some sort of reprisal from either the Revolution or the Bourgeoisie.
theLivesOfCommoners.node.30: It's at the height of your boredom that you notice a pair of women withdrawing from the crowd to talk. One of them glances over her shoulder to make sure she isn't being followed, which is always a good sign. You are drawn to them, as if you had stumbled upon an oasis in the desert.
theLivesOfCommoners.node.29: Eventually, you manage to find a fitting point for you to leave the conversation. All in all, a most fruitful endeavor.
theLivesOfCommoners.node.28: Eventually, you manage to find a fitting point for you to leave the conversation. All in all, a most fruitful endeavor.
theLivesOfCommoners.node.27: The conversation that follows is fascinating, in its own way. Even with all that she's learned, she's still extremely passionate about the ideals of the Bourgeoisie, and has embraced them with all of her heart.
theLivesOfCommoners.node.26: (You have lost a little favor with Madame Gazel)
theLivesOfCommoners.node.25: Naturally, that doesn't mean that you can evade the scrutiny that comes with prying into this particular case. You're sure that the consequences will come back to haunt you, and quickly.
theLivesOfCommoners.node.24: (You have gained a piece of Outrageous Bourgeoisie Gossip)
theLivesOfCommoners.node.23: (You have gained a piece of Shocking Bourgeoisie Gossip)
theLivesOfCommoners.node.22: (You have gained a piece of Cheap Bourgeoisie Gossip)
theLivesOfCommoners.node.21: It doesn't take long before she realizes that you're more than sympathetic to any woes that she might have. Soon, she's explaining the latest actions of the Bourgeoisie that have been tugging at her conscience.
theLivesOfCommoners.node.20: The conversation that follows is fascinating, in its own way. Even with all that she's learned, she's still extremely passionate about the Revolution, and has embraced it with all of her heart.
theLivesOfCommoners.node.19: (You have lost a little favor with Antoine)
theLivesOfCommoners.node.18: Naturally, that doesn't mean that you can evade the scrutiny that comes with prying into this particular case. You're sure that the consequences will come back to haunt you, and quickly.
theLivesOfCommoners.node.17: (You have gained a piece of Outrageous Revolutionary Gossip)
theLivesOfCommoners.node.16: (You have gained a piece of Shocking Revolutionary Gossip)
theLivesOfCommoners.node.15: (You have gained a piece of Cheap Revolution Gossip)
theLivesOfCommoners.node.14: It doesn't take long before she realizes that you're more than sympathetic to any woes that she might have. Soon, she's explaining the latest actions of the Revolution that have been tugging at her conscience.
theLivesOfCommoners.node.13: "Ah, have we met before?" She asks as she notices your approach. Her smile is a hastily assembled mask.
theLivesOfCommoners.node.12: "Ah, have we met before?" She asks as she notices your approach. Her smile is a hastily assembled mask.
theLivesOfCommoners.node.11: Unfortunately, that appears to have wasted some of your time, but hopefully you'll be able to find something else to accomplish, while you're here.
theLivesOfCommoners.node.9: If they want to make their own lives difficult, then that's their battle to fight. You, for one, will be taking your leave before you're caught up in the flames of their woes.
theLivesOfCommoners.node.8: You follow the Heiress as she parts from her companion. It'll be much easier to do this if she's alone, after all. You catch up with her, just as she's about to go outside and get some air.
theLivesOfCommoners.node.7: You follow the Constitutionalist as she parts from her companion. It'll be much easier to do this if she's alone, after all. You catch up with her, just as she's about to go outside and get some air.
theLivesOfCommoners.node.6: The two of them are starting to walk away from each other. Who will you follow?
theLivesOfCommoners.node.5: You don't need to be a mistress of intrigues to see that both of these people need someone to bare the contents of their hearts too. Normally, purloining such secrets would test your abilities, but this feels like the effort would be trivial.
theLivesOfCommoners.node.4: "It seems... it seems that neither of us has an avenue for recourse, then."
theLivesOfCommoners.node.3: It sounds like the kind of swift wrath that you're all too familiar with, due to your work with Pierre. Of course, that means it's something that you're at least able to navigate with some familiarity.
theLivesOfCommoners.node.2: "I wish I could offer some comfort, but I'm in a similar situation, albeit amongst the Bourgeoisie. If anyone found out what I knew, their wrath would be swift."
theLivesOfCommoners.node.1: "Should you go first, or should I? As fond as I am of my Revolutionary colleagues, I've heard some unsettling things as of late, and I simply don't know who I can confide in."
theLivesOfCommoners.node.0: As you walk another circle of the party, you find yourself disappointed by the mundanity of the conversations you overhear. Who knew a hotbed of revolutionaries could be so... dry?
theLivesOfCommoners.link.7: "I have enough enemies already. Let them keep their secrets."
theLivesOfCommoners.link.6: "I should follow the one on the right, as I'd like to learn more about the Bourgeoisie."
theLivesOfCommoners.link.5: "The one on the left knows something about the Revolution. I'll follow her."
anUninvitedInterlude.name: An Uninvited Interlude
anUninvitedInterlude.description: Your conversation with a clever woman could yield some valuable results, but first you’ll have to find a way to divert a certain meddlesome musician.
anUninvitedInterlude.node.23: With his songs completed, you leave them both behind to explore the rest of the party.
anUninvitedInterlude.node.22: With her story completed, you and your conversation partner follow the musician to his harpsichord, and he begins to play for a crowd. All the while, he seems extremely pleased with himself, and keeps looking at you like he's won some sort of victory. Men are truly strange, sometimes.
anUninvitedInterlude.node.21: (You have lost a decent amount of credibility)
anUninvitedInterlude.node.20: (You have gained a piece of Outrageous Crown Gossip)
anUninvitedInterlude.node.19: (You have gained a piece of Shocking Crown Gossip)
anUninvitedInterlude.node.18: (You have gained a piece of Cheap Crown Gossip)
anUninvitedInterlude.node.17: "Magnifique! Now, where was I?" She asks before delving into the details you'd been so eager to hear.
anUninvitedInterlude.node.16: Eventually, you give up on this particular lead. It appears you'll have to search somewhere else.
anUninvitedInterlude.node.15: Your conversation partner follows the musician to his harpsichord and he begins to play for a crowd. The music is good, but the conversation afterwards shifts entirely to musical specifics, and jests that are simply beyond your fields of expertise. It feels like you might as well not even be part of the conversation at all.
anUninvitedInterlude.node.14:
(You have lost a little credibility)

anUninvitedInterlude.node.13: Judging from the way she's speaking, it could possibly be rather outrageous. Better yet, you know it has something to do with the Crown.

anUninvitedInterlude.node.10: You exhale slowly, and acquiesce to his demand that you follow him. Though it feels like you've avoided some sort of conflict, you also feel less assured than before. Less confident in yourself.
anUninvitedInterlude.node.9: "I think that story can wait! Several others are already arriving to hear my work, and I was just inviting you to be polite." He hisses at you, in a way that feels distinctly impolite.
anUninvitedInterlude.node.8: "I think that story can wait! Several others are already arriving to hear my work, and I was just inviting you to be polite." He hisses at you, in a way that feels distinctly impolite.
anUninvitedInterlude.node.7: "Well, I imagine that would be proper. After you, madame." He sighs.
anUninvitedInterlude.node.6: "My story?" She asks, suddenly remembering where she was in her narrative.
anUninvitedInterlude.node.5: You can feel her focus on your previous discussion slipping away...
anUninvitedInterlude.node.4: "Oh, really? You're a musician?" She asks. "How intriguing!"
anUninvitedInterlude.node.3: "Would you both be interested in joining me at the harpsichord? I have a grand, new composition that I'm about to demonstrate."
anUninvitedInterlude.node.2: Suddenly, just as she's about to finish, a gentleman loudly barges into the middle of the conversation "Ah, good afternoon, madames!"
anUninvitedInterlude.node.1: Judging from the way she's speaking, it's likely to be cheap gossip, but it's still about the Crown, so that's still quite good.
anUninvitedInterlude.node.0: In the midst of your latest conversation, you feel the ethereal pull of a lead on gossip. You're absolutely certain that the woman you're speaking with knows something that Pierre would find valuable.
anUninvitedInterlude.link.9: "I suppose we can join you for a while..."
anUninvitedInterlude.link.8: "Pardon, but my friend was in the middle of a lovely story. I'd like to hear the rest."
anUninvitedInterlude.link.5: "Before that, you must hear the end of my friends' story. It's simply delightful!"
indulgence.name: Indulgence
indulgence.description: You find yourself speaking with a woman who could tell you of some gossip concerning the Church. All you have to do is deflect the tiresome bloviating of a particularly boastful church patron.
indulgence.node.24: However, you quickly realize that there's no end to his self aggrandizements. So, sensing the first opening in his words, you leave as fast as your feet can carry you.
indulgence.node.23: Not wanting to cause any more of a scene, you sit back and allow this interloper to flood the both of you with a deluge of his irrelevant stories about how important he is to the local parish. Clearly, he was never told that humility was a virtue... or that silence was golden.
indulgence.node.22: However, you quickly realize that there's no end to his self aggrandizements. So, sensing the first opening in his words, you leave as fast as your feet can carry you.
indulgence.node.21: With your valuable information obtained, you sit back and allow this interloper to flood the both of you with a deluge of his irrelevant stories about how important he is to the local parish. Clearly, he was never told that humility was a virtue... or that silence was golden.

indulgence.node.12: "Oh, by all means, madame..." He nods his head to the woman, almost puzzled at the idea that someone else could contribute something to a conversation.

indulgence.node.9: "What? I don't recall anyone else speaking." He replies in an accusatory tone of voice.
indulgence.node.7: Swollen with pride, you see him inhaling, preparing for what will be a flood of words.
indulgence.node.6: "Ah, well that's quite generous of you." She replies, taken aback by his sudden appearance in your conversation.
indulgence.node.5: "I see you two fine ladies are enjoying the chapel that I donated the funds for. Quite a lovely piece of architecture, isn't it? I've often felt that piety is best expressed with marble and gilt."
indulgence.node.4: Suddenly, a man approaches the two of you, speaking at a jarringly loud volume. "Good afternoon, mesdames!"
indulgence.node.3: Any gossip you manage to obtain from her would clearly concern the Church. In fact, you feel like the details would be rather outrageous, which could be quite valuable.

indulgence.node.1: Any gossip you manage to obtain from her would clearly concern the Church. Even if it's on the cheaper side, that's still valuable.
indulgence.node.0: Your latest conversation is taking place in a rather gaudy chapel, separated from the rest of the guests. Bathed in the light of a few votive candles, you're speaking with a woman who apparently knows quite a bit about the party's host.
indulgence.link.9: "Ah, then you're in luck! My friend was telling a story you'd love to hear."
scattershot.name: Scattershot
scattershot.description: The sister of an artilleryman seems to know simply everything that her brother overhears in the barracks, but to learn more, you’ll have to divert a tiresome boor who keeps interrupting.
scattershot.node.22:
Eventually, you manage to extract yourself from the conversation without absorbing too many insipid details about the Duchess de Tourzel's gardener.

Thank. God.
scattershot.node.21: (You have lost a decent amount of credibility)
scattershot.node.20: While you've carefully committed her story to memory, you still need to remain in this conversation for a little while, as exiting the moment you get what you want would arouse far too much suspicion. Just as you feared, this new interloper is extremely tiresome.
scattershot.node.19: (You gained a piece of Outrageous Military Gossip)
scattershot.node.18: (You gained a piece of Shocking Military Gossip)
scattershot.node.17: (You gained a piece of Cheap Military Gossip)
scattershot.node.16: "Ah, yes! Where was I?" Your storytelling acquaintance says, before launching into further detail on the latest she's heard from her brother.
scattershot.node.15: "Oh, don't worry, it's not particularly important." Your storytelling acquaintance replies. This disappointment is only worsened by the bizarely triumphant smile you receive from the interloper.
scattershot.node.14: "Oh, I had no idea. Please, do go on..." The interloper replies, almost disoriented by the revelation that other people have interesting things to say.
scattershot.node.12:
Eventually, you manage to extract yourself from the conversation without absorbing too many insipid details about the Duchess de Tourzel's gardener.

Thank. God.

scattershot.node.9: You sigh and let the lead slip from your grasp. You tell yourself that the conflict simply isn't worth it, but admitting defeat like this bothers you. It's not that you have a particular distaste for flowers, it's that you let a stranger completely brush you aside like that.
scattershot.node.8: "I mean... of course it can wait..." The interloper replies, clearly intent on nurturing this grudge until her dying day.
scattershot.node.6: You can feel the conversation pulling away, but you don't yet have what you need.
scattershot.node.5: "I had no idea! Are they from her personal gardens?" Your conversation partner replies.
scattershot.node.4: Just as you're about to learn what you need to know, another woman suddenly wanders into your conversation, gesturing to a flower arrangement on a nearby table. "Oh! Have you two heard that these flowers were gifted by the Duchess de Tourzel?"
scattershot.node.3: While she hasn't gotten to the details yet, you know that whatever outrageous rumors she's heard will concern the military.
scattershot.node.2: While she hasn't gotten to the details yet, you know that whatever shocking rumors she's heard will concern the military.
scattershot.node.1: While she hasn't gotten to the details yet, you know that whatever cheap rumors she's heard will concern the military.
scattershot.node.0: At this moment, you're in the middle of chatting with a woman who seems to be in possession of exactly the kind of rumors you're looking for. Her brother is an artilleryman, who also happens to gamble like a fiend, and loves telling stories about the last indecorous goings-on that he overhears in the process.
scattershot.link.9: "Pardon, madame, but we were in the middle of something. Can this wait?"
scattershot.link.8: "Ah! That ties in so well to the story that my friend was just telling!"
businessAsUsual.name: Business As Usual
businessAsUsual.description: A gregarious woman seems to have exactly the sort of rumors you’re looking for, but first you’ll have to stave off the blundering boasts of a young sugar magnate.
businessAsUsual.node.23: (You have lost a decent amount of credibility)

businessAsUsual.node.21: "Well, if you say so, I don't see the harm in it..." The intruder mumbles.
businessAsUsual.node.20: Thankfully, you manage to find a way to tactfully excuse yourself, and get as far away from him as possible.
businessAsUsual.node.19: With her story told, and its relevant details memorized, you stay and listen to the encroaching entrepreneur's various boasts about his company's success. He is every bit as unbearable as you initially suspected. Sometimes, it's awful to be right.

businessAsUsual.node.10: Obligingly, you raise your glass and toast to his success, but even this fine wine merely tastes of ashes. You didn't want to cause a scene, but allowing this stranger to talk over the both of you is enough to sap your spirits.
businessAsUsual.node.9: "Excusez moi?" He asks, taken absolutely aback.
businessAsUsual.node.8: "Ah yes, where was I?" Your storytelling companion says, trying to remember where she'd left off.
businessAsUsual.node.7: If this boor keeps talking, you'll never get to hear the end of her story...
businessAsUsual.node.6: "Ah, you'll both be so excited to hear what we have planned for the next season." He says, not even waiting for either of you to respond.
businessAsUsual.node.5: "... to my sugar importing company! We're having a very successful year, you see."
businessAsUsual.node.4: Just as she's about to reach the story's climax, a man suddenly enters your conversation. "Good afternoon, madames! Allow me to interrupt you for a moment to propose a toast..."
businessAsUsual.node.3: She's currently in the middle of regaling you with a rumor that she's heard over the course of her various dalliances. It feels likely to be of the outrageous sort, but relevant to the Bourgeoisie.

businessAsUsual.node.0: You find yourself in the middle of a conversation with a particularly energetic guest. She flits easily between social circles, and has a disarming laugh that seems to make people feel comfortable enough to just trust her implicitly. Perhaps you can practice such a laugh, later.
businessAsUsual.link.11: "Ah... yes... to your sugar importing company."
businessAsUsual.link.10: "I'm sorry madame, what were you saying before you were interrupted?"
businessAsUsual.link.9: "I'm glad to see you in such high spirits. If that's true, you'll love to hear my friend's story."
deepConcern.name: Deep Concern
deepConcern.description: Speaking with a revolutionary woman, you feel like you should be able to obtain some valuable gossip. However, first you’ll have to contend with an interloper whose faux concern seems hellbent on stymying conversation at every turn.
deepConcern.node.22: Eventually, you take your leave of them both.
deepConcern.node.21: (You have lost a decent amount of credibility)
deepConcern.node.20: With the valuable details memorized, you continue the conversation, only to find that the interloper doesn't have much to contribute herself. Apparently, needlessly chiding others is her chief method of interacting with the world around her.
deepConcern.node.19: (You have gained a piece of Outrageous Revolution Gossip)
deepConcern.node.18: (You have gained a piece of Shocking Revolution Gossip)
deepConcern.node.17: (You have gained a piece of Cheap Revolution Gossip)
deepConcern.node.16: "Now then, as I was saying..." Your conversation partner says, smiling as she begins to delve deeper into the details of the latest indecorous conduct that she's overheard.
deepConcern.node.14: "That is clearly not the case!" The interloper hisses at you both between her teeth.
deepConcern.node.13: "Fine. I can wait then, to see if there's any merit to this." The interloper concedes slowly.
deepConcern.node.12: Eventually, you take your leave of them both.
deepConcern.node.11: Within only a few exchanges, their discussion has descended into petty bickering, and nothing of any consequence is accomplished.
deepConcern.node.10:
(You have lost a little credibility)
(You have lost a little peril)
deepConcern.node.9: Not wanting to pull any of the building anger in your own direction, you step back and let the two argue. While you may have avoided danger, there's something demoralizing about having to let a lead go like this.
deepConcern.node.8: "What did you say?" The concerned interloper hisses at you between her teeth.
deepConcern.node.7: "I assure you that I am both specific, and egalitarian with my personal venom."
deepConcern.node.6: If you let this go on, you'll never hear the rest of that rumor...
deepConcern.node.5: "I'm not saying that it is. I'm referring to a specific person."
deepConcern.node.4: "Well that's not true of all revolutionaries!" Interrupts a woman who has strode into the middle of your conversation.
deepConcern.node.3: It becomes clear that she considers nobody beyond reproach, which generally means that she enjoys excoriating them for their various perceived failings. The outrageous rumors she's discussing at the moment are sure to concern the goings-on of the Revolution.
deepConcern.node.2: It becomes clear that she considers nobody beyond reproach, which generally means that she enjoys excoriating them for their various perceived failings. The shocking rumors she's discussing at the moment are sure to concern the goings-on of the Revolution.
