churchPartyRepeatable.name: A Holy Intrigue
churchPartyRepeatable.description: A rather run of the mill interaction with a pious woman at a party. You might find yourself having many like it, in the future.
churchPartyRepeatable.node.26: "Then again, perhaps this is a sign for me to keep my tongue to myself."
churchPartyRepeatable.node.25: "I finally have something interesting to talk about, and not a single one of these people will even do me the courtesy of a smile. It's just so... unwelcoming."
churchPartyRepeatable.node.24: (You have gained a piece of Cheap Church Gossip)
churchPartyRepeatable.node.23: With that, she laughs, and begins to let you in on a juicy little rumor you'd never heard before.
churchPartyRepeatable.node.21: That being said, she leaves, and you are left to your own infernal devices.
churchPartyRepeatable.node.20: "If you think there will be no consequences for this behavior, in a house of God, then you are absolutely wrong."
churchPartyRepeatable.node.19: (You have gained a piece of Cheap Church Gossip)
churchPartyRepeatable.node.18: She gives up this rumor, distilling it down to its most essential elements. She clearly has no interest in entertaining you with this particular story.
churchPartyRepeatable.node.17: "Yet, I seem to have no other choice." She admits, glancing suspiciously at the guests who she was maligning, but moments ago. "Fine, I'll tell you what I know."
churchPartyRepeatable.node.16: (You have gained a decent amount of peril)
churchPartyRepeatable.node.15: Before you can point out that she's the one who volunteered that she had such a rumor in the first place, she storms off, leaving you to look quite the fool.
churchPartyRepeatable.node.14: Just as things start to slow down, you slip away, to search for other opportunities.
churchPartyRepeatable.node.13: With said rumor firmly planted in your memory, you stretch the conversation out a little with basic repartee, and just try to be welcoming. The two of you talk for some time, and you briefly forget how quiet and lifeless everything was, but a few moments ago.
churchPartyRepeatable.node.12: (You have gained a piece of Cheap Church Gossip)
churchPartyRepeatable.node.11:
(You have lost a decent amount of credibility)
(You have gained a little peril)
churchPartyRepeatable.node.10: "No, I shouldn't be spreading such scurrilous rumors, and the fact that you're clearly trying to pry them out of me only confirms that fact!"
churchPartyRepeatable.node.9: "Then again, if I can't talk to you, then who can I speak with?" She laughs, and begins to let you in on a juicy little rumor you'd never heard before.
churchPartyRepeatable.node.8: "Then I don't know what I'd bother speaking with you." She replies, turning up her nose at you.
churchPartyRepeatable.node.7: "That's all the better then! If you have nothing interesting to say, then perhaps you'll enjoy this!" She says, leaving you uncertain as to whether you've just been insulted or not.
churchPartyRepeatable.node.5: "Are you serious? You really want to threaten me, just to hear what I've overheard? I didn't expect you to be so craven."
churchPartyRepeatable.node.3: "I assume your situation is similar, then?"
churchPartyRepeatable.node.2: "Bonjour." She sighs. "I assume you're having trouble starting a conversation as well? I swear, some people seem to think that the moment they align themselves with the Church, that they have to exorcise themselves of any remaining mirth or wit."
churchPartyRepeatable.node.1: Right as you're about to give up, you notice someone who looks nearly as bored as you are. She's staring at the other guests with an expression you can only describe as 'barely concealed contempt'. She notices your approach.
churchPartyRepeatable.node.0: In your experience, the Church's parties tend to be quieter than most and right now, this one is no exception. You're unsure if it's the guests or the venue, but people simply aren't talking as much as you'd hope.
churchPartyRepeatable.link.4: "Not really. I don't think I have anything to say at all."
churchPartyRepeatable.link.3: "My situation is that I need to know that rumor. It would be safer for you, if you obliged..."
churchPartyRepeatable.link.2: "Maybe I'm just the person you should be speaking to."
militaryPartyRepeatable.name: A Martial Intrigue
militaryPartyRepeatable.description: A rather run of the mill interaction with a lone aristocrat at a party. You might find yourself having many like it, in the future.
militaryPartyRepeatable.node.25: "Though, every time I return, I seem to overhear things salacious enough to remind me why I stay away..."
militaryPartyRepeatable.node.24: (You have gained a piece of Cheap Military Gossip)
militaryPartyRepeatable.node.23: "Still, if you haven't spoken with anyone else, I suppose there's nothing dangerous in telling you what's been bothering me about these rumors."
militaryPartyRepeatable.node.21: With that, he leaves, wrongly thinking himself the victor in your confrontation. Satisfied, you search the field for other battles.
militaryPartyRepeatable.node.20: "I think this conversation is over." He says, already turning smartly on his heel. "Good day."
militaryPartyRepeatable.node.19: (You have gained a piece of Cheap Military Gossip)
militaryPartyRepeatable.node.18: He outlines the rumor to you, putting a strong emphasis on the elements that make it so disagreeable. Presumably, this is part of some misplaced strategy to cow you, but really it just gives you exactly what you want.
militaryPartyRepeatable.node.17: "However, it can never be said that I was one to shrink from a challenge. Perhaps this will be enough to still your insolent tongue."
militaryPartyRepeatable.node.16: (You have gained a decent amount of peril)
militaryPartyRepeatable.node.15: Before you can even attempt to change his mind, he marches away, and you are left to look for some new other target to approach.
militaryPartyRepeatable.node.14: Just as the conversation starts to slow, you find a way to retreat, without arousing too much suspicion.
militaryPartyRepeatable.node.13: With the details of the rumor firmly secured, you divert the conversation to some relatively tame but still interesting stories. Enough to be daring, but not upsetting.
militaryPartyRepeatable.node.12: (You have gained a piece of Cheap Military Gossip)
militaryPartyRepeatable.node.11:
(You have lost a decent amount of credibility)
(You have gained a little peril)
militaryPartyRepeatable.node.10: "No, I shan't repeat it, and the fact that you want to know more about such dreadful things only cements my decision."
militaryPartyRepeatable.node.9: "I don't know what drives such ghoulish curiosity, but if you really seek this prize, I won't deny you."
militaryPartyRepeatable.node.8: "Do I look like some sort of social pariah to you? Is this a cruel jape being played by the other guests?" He asks angrily, scanning the crowd for onlookers.
militaryPartyRepeatable.node.7: "Surely you know it's foolish to attend a party if you have no intent on approaching the other guests." He says, barely attempting to conceal his patronizing tone.
militaryPartyRepeatable.node.6: "Really, you've spoken with no one else?"
militaryPartyRepeatable.node.5: "Quit the field? Your presumption seems only matched by your self regard."
militaryPartyRepeatable.node.3: "Ah, I'm being dreadfully rude! Please, how are you enjoying yourself?"
militaryPartyRepeatable.node.2: "Ah, salut madame!" He says with a curious informality. "Don't worry about feeling out of place, I rarely come to these things either. Unlike some of the souls here, I swore to myself that I wouldn't let my time in the army be the most interesting thing that ever happened to me."
militaryPartyRepeatable.node.1: Your reconnaissance eventually leads you to a veteran standing by himself between the tents. He's standing alone, but doesn't seem particularly perturbed by this fact. He's wearing the ribbons of some kind of gallant or knightly order, but those badges honestly all look the same to you.
militaryPartyRepeatable.node.0: You stroll between the tents in the field, examining all of the different groups sheltering from the sun. This is one of the few places where you can attend a party frequented by both commoners and the nobility, and still they instinctively filter themselves by rank. Nevertheless, every guest feels deeply connected with every other... except for you.
militaryPartyRepeatable.link.4: "I don't really know. I haven't talking to anyone else, and I just feel lost."
militaryPartyRepeatable.link.3: "You've quit the field over a few unseemly rumors? Whatever could they be?"
militaryPartyRepeatable.link.2: "What's so awful that it could drive a gallant man like you away?"
bourgeoisiePartyRepeatable.name: A Commercial Intrigue
bourgeoisiePartyRepeatable.description: A rather run of the mill interaction with a lone bourgeois man at a party. You might find yourself having many like it, in the future.
bourgeoisiePartyRepeatable.node.25: "Truth be told, the rumors I've just heard about my own business partners tonight have only added to my list of woes, should they prove to be true."
bourgeoisiePartyRepeatable.node.24: (You have gained a piece of Cheap Bourgeoisie Gossip)
bourgeoisiePartyRepeatable.node.23: "Well, when you put it that way, what I've heard doesn't sound quite so terrible!" He laughs, before starting to explain the rumors about his business partners that have been bothering him so.
bourgeoisiePartyRepeatable.node.21: With that, he hurries away, already muttering fresh curses and worries to himself. Undaunted, you search the party for more potential sources of profit.
bourgeoisiePartyRepeatable.node.20: "Are you happy now?" He asks, already turning away from you to leave.
bourgeoisiePartyRepeatable.node.19: (You have gained a piece of Cheap Bourgeoisie Gossip)
bourgeoisiePartyRepeatable.node.18:
He outlines the rumor about his business partners to you, taking great pains to emphasize how he was both unaware of this situation, and completely uninvolved in it. 

Not that it matters to you, or to Pierre.
bourgeoisiePartyRepeatable.node.17: "Nevertheless, I don't have the time to go chasing down every possible leak. Fine, if you wish to know so badly, you can hear this and choke on it."
bourgeoisiePartyRepeatable.node.16: (You have gained a decent amount of peril)
bourgeoisiePartyRepeatable.node.15: Before you can argue your own defense, he hurries away, already muttering fresh curses and worries to himself. Hopefully, you can accomplish something else here tonight.
bourgeoisiePartyRepeatable.node.14: As soon as he seems less burdened by his woes, you excuse yourself and explore the rest of the party.
bourgeoisiePartyRepeatable.node.13: While you pretend to lend a sympathetic ear to his plight, you hungrily drink in every last detail. When he finishes, you ask a few tame questions about his business, and otherwise do your best to bolster his spirits.
bourgeoisiePartyRepeatable.node.12: (You have gained a piece of Cheap Bourgeoisie Gossip)
bourgeoisiePartyRepeatable.node.11:
(You have lost a decent amount of credibility)
(You have gained a little peril)
bourgeoisiePartyRepeatable.node.10: "Well, it won't! It's bad enough that I've heard this at all. If I continue to repeat it, there's a good chance that my clients will find out-" He suddenly stops and shoots you a look of suspicion. "Or was that your intention from the very beginning?"
bourgeoisiePartyRepeatable.node.9: "Well, it's certainly a better idea than what I've been doing so far!" He laughs, before starting to explain the rumors about his business partners that have been bothering him so.
bourgeoisiePartyRepeatable.node.8: In an attempt to distract him, you start telling him a story based on one of the latest pieces of Bourgeoisie gossip you've overheard recently. However, instead of distracting him, it only seems to agitate him further. "Madame, are you trying to give me apoplexy? That rumor you're sharing concerns yet another one of my business partners!"
bourgeoisiePartyRepeatable.node.7: In an attempt to distract him, you start telling a story based on one of the latest pieces of Bourgeoisie gossip you've overheard recently. The story elicits a few chuckles from him, though you can tell that he's judging you for sharing gossip so freely.
bourgeoisiePartyRepeatable.node.5: "Madame, I know a thinly veiled threat when I hear one." He growls at you.
bourgeoisiePartyRepeatable.node.4: "You thinking giving voice to these concerns will lessen their weight?"
bourgeoisiePartyRepeatable.node.3: "Is there any chance you can take my mind off of this building pile of misery?"
bourgeoisiePartyRepeatable.node.2: "Je suis désolé, madame..." He says, finally looking you in the eye. "I thought that coming to this party might distract me from my troubles, but I was wrong. Now I'm failing to concentrate on my work and failing to fulfill my social obligations."
bourgeoisiePartyRepeatable.node.1: Amidst your evaluation, you nearly bump into a worried looking man, who barely seems to notice you. He's muttering something to himself, while he stares off into space.
bourgeoisiePartyRepeatable.node.0: You move between the richly appointed rooms of the grand house, each more opulent than the last. The tasteless excess of splendor is equal parts amusing and intimidating. Wealth wielded as a social weapon, without even barest fig leaf of pretense.
bourgeoisiePartyRepeatable.link.4: "I've heard rumors recently that surely must be worse than what you've learned, just now."
bourgeoisiePartyRepeatable.link.3: "Your business partners? Involved in scandal? I hope your clients don't find out first."
bourgeoisiePartyRepeatable.link.2: "It's better to voice one's woes than run from them. What rumors have you heard?"
revolutionPartyRepeatable.name: A Nationalist Intrigue
revolutionPartyRepeatable.description: A rather run of the mill interaction with a lone revolutionary woman at a party. You might find yourself having many like it, in the future.
revolutionPartyRepeatable.node.23: You giggle amongst yourselves for a while as she provides you with all the details, but you slowly realize that you've both been talking a little too loudly about such a sensitive subject. This will surely come back to haunt you at some point.
revolutionPartyRepeatable.node.22: "That I can even consider this might be why I like the Revolution so much. Everyone's so fascinated by the powerful women among the aristocracy, but they're the exception, not the rule. Most of the ladies there still have to content themselves with being a living ornament that sometimes gets spoken at. The Revolution feels willing to upend everything."
revolutionPartyRepeatable.node.21: You swear, every time you attend a party for the Revolution, it gets more and more crowded.
revolutionPartyRepeatable.node.20: "I suppose that's why I'm willing to tolerate some of the less desirable things I've recently heard about the Revolution." She continues, nibbling on a small pastry. "Does that make me craven?"
revolutionPartyRepeatable.node.19: "Well, when you put it that way, what I've heard doesn't sound quite so terrible!" She laughs, before starting to explain the rumors about prominent revolutionaries that have been bothering her so much.
revolutionPartyRepeatable.node.17: (You have gained a piece of Cheap Revolution Gossip)
revolutionPartyRepeatable.node.16: As your conversation starts to die down, she decides to rejoin the crowds, and you are left to consider your next move.
revolutionPartyRepeatable.node.15: Once you've unburderened her from the rumor that she's overheard, you converse with her with a little longer, hoping to find any additional valuable information. Unfortunately, nothing else appears to be forthcoming.
revolutionPartyRepeatable.node.14: (You have gained a decent amount of peril)
revolutionPartyRepeatable.node.13: Before you can try to convince her otherwise, she hurries away, clearly trying to distance herself from you both physically and idealogically. Hopefully, you can accomplish something else here tonight.
revolutionPartyRepeatable.node.12: (You have gained a piece of Cheap Revolution Gossip)
revolutionPartyRepeatable.node.11:
(You have lost a decent amount of credibility)
(You have gained a little peril)
revolutionPartyRepeatable.node.10: ""That's ridiculous! My situation here is tenuous enough already. I don't need to spend my time picking apart every little mistake someone else has made. Nor should you."
revolutionPartyRepeatable.node.9: "I suppose I can't see the harm in that!" She laughs, then begins to regale you with what's been bothering her. Naturally, you hang onto her every word.
revolutionPartyRepeatable.node.8: You launch into what you think to be an entertaining story, but it doesn't seem to hold her attention at all. She's clearly far too anxious to consider anything else, even as a distraction. "No! No! My situation here is tenuous enough already. I don't need to spend my time picking apart every little mistake someone else has made. Nor should you."
revolutionPartyRepeatable.node.7: Attempting to distract her, you tell her a story based on one of the latest pieces of Revolution gossip that you've overheard. She laughs politely, but you can tell that she's judging you for freely sharing a story that depicts the Revolution in a negative light.
revolutionPartyRepeatable.node.6: "Something to brighten my spirits? Like what?"
revolutionPartyRepeatable.node.5: "You know what? You're absolutely right!" She laughs, then begins to regale you with what's been bothering her. Naturally, you hang onto her every word.
revolutionPartyRepeatable.node.4: "You want to help me think a rumor through?" She asks, genuinely caught off guard.
revolutionPartyRepeatable.node.3: "Ugh..." She sighs. "I need to spend less time focusing on frustrations and miseries."
revolutionPartyRepeatable.node.2: "Ah, are you having trouble navigating the crowds as well? I'm starting to wish I wore something that takes up a little less space, myself." She says, gesturing to her dress. "I know I look the picture of elegance and beauty right now, but that doesn't stop me from being frustrated at yet another person bumping into me."
revolutionPartyRepeatable.node.1: Just as you're starting to find it hard to breathe, you find yourself in a dining room that's surprisingly empty. Perhaps this is the eye of the storm? A woman looks up from her plate of hors d'oeuvres at you.
revolutionPartyRepeatable.node.0: You find yourself moving among the congested rooms of the party, attempting to find some sort of respite. Everywhere you turn, there's another throng of increasingly agitated people.
revolutionPartyRepeatable.link.4: "That sounds lovely! Surely, I have something that'll brighten your spirits."
revolutionPartyRepeatable.link.3: "I must disagree! We should revel in how terrible other people are. What have you heard?"
revolutionPartyRepeatable.link.2: "Perhaps you can tell me what you've heard, and we can determine if it's truly awful?"
parismap.description.missionCommissionin: If you’re to bring vengeance upon Maximin by proving his foul misdeeds, you’ll need to commission a painting from an incredible painter. Madame Le Brun may be just the person for the task.
aRequestForAid.name: A Request for Aid
aRequestForAid.node.7: ('Legacy' is now available to visit in the Paris map)
aRequestForAid.node.6: Looking at the address you noted in you journal, you pause to consult your map of the city. The address appears to point towards a cemetery. What could he possibly need there?
aRequestForAid.node.4: 'Though I may be known for my considerable vigor, there are things I would still rather have reinforcements for. Please understand that I do not make such a request lightly.'
aRequestForAid.node.3:
The letter lists an address on it, but seems to provide no other context. You note it down in your journal.

'I'll be positioned here, near midday, for the foreseeable future. Please join me, if you can.'
aRequestForAid.node.2: 'Chère Yvette, While I hope this letter finds you well, I write to ask you for a favor. There is a place I need you to meet me, so that I can do something that I've been meaning to do for quite some time.'
aRequestForAid.node.1: Examining the letter's seal and address, it appears to be from Corporal Dumas. Opening the letter, you find it written in his well practiced, and flowing handwriting.
aRequestForAid.node.0: Waking up to the sound of the wind rattling your shutters, you sit up and languidly stretch your arms. It appears that Camille has left a unopened letter on your bedside table. It's sealed with blue wax.
aColleagueInJournalismCrown.name: A Colleague in Journalism
aColleagueInJournalismCrown.description: There’s a woman here who apparently used to work with Pierre in the past. As a fellow huntress of gossip and rumors, the two of you might have quite a lot to talk about.
aColleagueInJournalismCrown.node.42: (You have gained a piece of Outrageous Crown Gossip)
aColleagueInJournalismCrown.node.41: (You have gained a piece of Shocking Crown Gossip)
aColleagueInJournalismCrown.node.40: (You have gained a piece of Outrageous Crown Gossip)
aColleagueInJournalismCrown.node.39: (You have gained a piece of Cheap Crown Gossip)
aColleagueInJournalismCrown.node.38: The two of you stick around together, chatting for a while, before you find that there's nothing else to be gained from this conversation. Eventually, you party ways with him.
aColleagueInJournalismCrown.node.37: (You have gained a piece of Cheap Crown Gossip)
aColleagueInJournalismCrown.node.36: You manage to draw some interesting details surrounding one of the latest court scandals from him, but like a good gentleman, he attempts to remain discreet and it's hard to get the full story. Admittedly, this would have been a lot easier if you had some help.
aColleagueInJournalismCrown.node.35: You come upon the Comte de Boulainvilliers, and engage him in conversation. The two of you have never met before, but your reputation precedes you enough that he's intrigued from the start.
aColleagueInJournalismCrown.node.34:
(You have lost some credibility)
(You have gained some peril)
aColleagueInJournalismCrown.node.33: The three of you stick around together, chatting for a while, before you find that there's nothing else to be gained from this conversation. Eventually, you part ways.
aColleagueInJournalismCrown.node.32: (You have gained a piece of Shocking Crown Gossip)
aColleagueInJournalismCrown.node.31: The two of you alternate in your conversation with him, slowly drawing out details of the latest court scandals. Like a good gentleman, he attempts to remain discreet, but against the two of you, he doesn't stand a chance against the two pronged ambush of your charms.
aColleagueInJournalismCrown.node.30: She leads you over to the Comte de Boulainvilliers, and engages him in conversation. It looks like they've met before, but he has no idea what her actual profession is.
aColleagueInJournalismCrown.node.29: You decide to search the rest of the party, and see if there's anything else for you to do.
aColleagueInJournalismCrown.node.28: Anne leaves, and you're left trying to figure out what you'll do for the rest of the party. You certainly won't be following her anytime soon.
aColleagueInJournalismCrown.node.27: "I will be going about my business now. Do not even dare to try to follow me." She hisses to you in a tone that even you find quite forbidding.
aColleagueInJournalismCrown.node.26: (You have lost a decent amount of credibility)
aColleagueInJournalismCrown.node.25: "For all of his failings, Pierre has his principles, and I admire that. However, you've seen his operation. The man is barely holding it together, and I couldn't trust my living on something like that."
aColleagueInJournalismCrown.node.24:
She gives you a nod and a smile, then steps away from the conversation to find her quarry...

...Or is it interviewee? Is there really a difference?
aColleagueInJournalismCrown.node.22: But you're already off, in search of this Comte de Boulainvilliers. You're certain that this won't earn you any favors with her, but at least you'll get something valuable to sell to Pierre.
aColleagueInJournalismCrown.node.21: "I think not. I would have to be a complete fool to let you take this prize away from me before I've even started." She replies, calm and cold.
aColleagueInJournalismCrown.node.20: "I'd be agreeable to such a plan. If we both sold the story to our respective employers at the same time, they'd be none the wiser."
aColleagueInJournalismCrown.node.19: "Ah, fantastique." She sighs. "It's nice to know there are still people with a sense of decency in our line of work."
aColleagueInJournalismCrown.node.18: "You wouldn't dare..." She mutters, fixing you with a steely glare.
aColleagueInJournalismCrown.node.16: "Simply put, I'm here to find something interesting related to the Crown. Can I trust you to stay out of my way?"
aColleagueInJournalismCrown.node.15: She chuckles into her drink. "Ah, he'll do that, you know..."
aColleagueInJournalismCrown.node.14: Normally you'd think that she was joking, but this is Pierre we're talking about here...
aColleagueInJournalismCrown.node.13: "By the way, I'm not certain what you're doing here tonight, but I'm here to 'interview' the Comte de Boulainvilliers. I mean, he doesn't know it's an interview, but that's not important."
aColleagueInJournalismCrown.node.12: "Well, when the Crown finally put a halt to royal censorship, newspapers started cropping up everywhere. Suddenly, it became clear that Pierre was only a big fish because he'd been swimming in a little pond."
aColleagueInJournalismCrown.node.11: "Hah! Can you imagine?" She laughs. "I once saw the man wager a full week's wages on wig louse racing."
aColleagueInJournalismCrown.node.10: "Yet somehow, I swear that weasel of a man will manage to outlive us all."
aColleagueInJournalismCrown.node.9: "How's Pierre's doing, by the way? Does he still gamble like a madman?"
aColleagueInJournalismCrown.node.8: "Of course, since then I've moved on, to greener pastures."
aColleagueInJournalismCrown.node.7: "However, I've heard that he's even gone so far as to promote you to being his journalist. Either that was very difficult, or he's getting desperate."
aColleagueInJournalismCrown.node.6: "I used to work for him as a rumor monger, a long time ago before his boss passed away and bequeathed him the newspaper."
aColleagueInJournalismCrown.node.5: "Forgive me, but I'd be an awful gossip monger if I didn't. You're quite the popular subject of conversation, after all."
aColleagueInJournalismCrown.node.4: "Hmph... I'd heard rumors about you, but none of them mentioned that you have no manners."
aColleagueInJournalismCrown.node.3: "My name is Anne de Croismare. We're both acquainted with Pierre Renaudot. Funny little man, isn't he?"
aColleagueInJournalismCrown.node.2: "Ah, I thought so. You seemed to match all the rumors I've heard."
aColleagueInJournalismCrown.node.1: "Yvette Decaux, I take it?" She asks, sipping on a glass of white wine.
aColleagueInJournalismCrown.node.0: You approach a woman who's been eyeing the other guests in a particular, familiar way. In fact, it's the exact same way you look at guests at these functions. She looks up at you.
aColleagueInJournalismCrown.link.22: "Don't worry, I won't get in the way."
aColleagueInJournalismCrown.link.21: "You're saying he has something worth writing about? Thanks for the tip."
aColleagueInJournalismCrown.link.20: "What say you and I interview him together? Together, we'll cover every angle."
aColleagueInJournalismCrown.link.17: "I'm not sure, is that what he does when he sobers up?"
aColleagueInJournalismCrown.link.11: "Why did you stop working with Pierre in the first place?"
aColleagueInJournalismCrown.link.10: "Oh no, he doesn't even drink anymore. I hear the Pope might have him canonized."
aColleagueInJournalismCrown.link.2: "Who are you, and what are you doing here?"

aColleagueInJournalismMilitary.node.2: "Ah, I thought so. You seemed to match all the rumors I've heard."
aColleagueInJournalismMilitary.node.1: "Yvette Decaux, I take it?" She asks, sipping on a glass of white wine.

aColleagueInJournalismBourgeoisie.name: A Colleague in Journalism
aColleagueInJournalismBourgeoisie.descri: There’s a woman here who apparently used to work with Pierre in the past. As a fellow huntress of gossip and rumors, the two of you might have quite a lot to talk about.
aColleagueInJournalismBourgeoisie.node.4: (You have gained a piece of Outrageous Bourgeoisie Gossip)
(You have gained a piece of Shocking Bourgeoisie Gossip)
(You have gained a piece of Outrageous Bourgeoisie Gossip)
aColleagueInJournalismBourgeoisie.node.3: (You have gained a piece of Cheap Bourgeoisie Gossip)
The two of you stick around together, chatting for a while, before you find that there's nothing else to be gained from this conversation. Eventually, you party ways with him.
(You have gained a piece of Cheap Bourgeoisie Gossip)

You manage to draw some interesting details surrounding one of the latest scandals from him, but like a good gentleman, he attempts to remain discreet and it's hard to get the full story. Admittedly, this would have been a lot easier if you had some help.
You come upon the Comte de Boulainvilliers, and engage him in conversation. The two of you have never met before, but your reputation precedes you enough that he's intrigued from the start.

(You have lost some credibility)
(You have gained some peril)
The three of you stick around together, chatting for a while, before you find that there's nothing else to be gained from this conversation. Eventually, you part ways.
(You have gained a piece of Shocking Bourgeoisie Gossip)

The two of you alternate in your conversation with him, slowly drawing out details of the latest scandals. Like a good gentleman, he attempts to remain discreet, but against the two of you, he doesn't stand a chance against the two pronged ambush of your charms.
She leads you over to the Comte de Boulainvilliers, and engages him in conversation. It looks like they've met before, but he has no idea what her actual profession is.
aColleagueInJournalismBourgeoisie.node.2: You decide to search the rest of the party, and see if there's anything else for you to do.
Anne leaves, and you're left trying to figure out what you'll do for the rest of the party. You certainly won't be following her anytime soon.
"I will be going about my business now. Do not even dare to try to follow me." She hisses to you in a tone that even you find quite forbidding.
(You have lost a decent amount of credibility)

"For all of his failings, Pierre has his principles, and I admire that. However, you've seen his operation. The man is barely holding it together, and I couldn't trust my living on something like that."

She gives you a nod and a smile, then steps away from the conversation to find her quarry...

...Or is it interviewee? Is there really a difference?
But you're already off, in search of this Comte de Boulainvilliers. You're certain that this won't earn you any favors with her, but at least you'll get something valuable to sell to Pierre.
"I think not. I would have to be a complete fool to let you take this prize away from me before I've even started." She replies, calm and cold.
"I'd be agreeable to such a plan. If we both sold the story to our respective employers at the same time, they'd be none the wiser."
aColleagueInJournalismBourgeoisie.node.1: "Ah, fantastique." She sighs. "It's nice to know there are still people with a sense of decency in our line of work."
"You wouldn't dare..." She mutters, fixing you with a steely glare.
"Simply put, I'm here to find something interesting related to the Bourgeoisie. Can I trust you to stay out of my way?"
She chuckles into her drink. "Ah, he'll do that, you know..."
Normally you'd think that she was joking, but this is Pierre we're talking about here...
"By the way, I'm not certain what you're doing here tonight, but I'm here to 'interview' the Comte de Boulainvilliers. I mean, he doesn't know it's an interview, but that's not important."

"Well, when the Crown finally put a halt to royal censorship, newspapers started cropping up everywhere. Suddenly, it became clear that Pierre was only a big fish because he'd been swimming in a little pond."
"Hah! Can you imagine?" She laughs. "I once saw the man wager a full week's wages on wig louse racing."
"Yet somehow, I swear that weasel of a man will manage to outlive us all."
aColleagueInJournalismBourgeoisie.node.9: "How's Pierre's doing, by the way? Does he still gamble like a madman?"
aColleagueInJournalismBourgeoisie.node.8: "Of course, since then I've moved on, to greener pastures."
aColleagueInJournalismBourgeoisie.node.7: "However, I've heard that he's even gone so far as to promote you to being his journalist. Either that was very difficult, or he's getting desperate."
aColleagueInJournalismBourgeoisie.node.6: "I used to work for him as a rumor monger, a long time ago before his boss passed away and bequeathed him the newspaper."
aColleagueInJournalismBourgeoisie.node.5: "Forgive me, but I'd be an awful gossip monger if I didn't. You're quite the popular subject of conversation, after all."

aDarkMirrorBourgeoisieCrownAndRevolution: A Dark Mirror

You’re approached by a woman wearing a green emerald about her neck, and something about her feels wholly too familiar. Is it because she seems to know so much about your past, or is it... something else?

"Every step I've taken since then has taken me higher. Higher in stature, higher in society, higher in peril. I have succeeded at everything I've touched. It is who I am. The fact that Armand refused to see that when I'm-"
(You have gained a decent amount of credibility)
"Oh.. oh, well played." Johanna says with a sudden smile. "I'll be certain to stay on my toes around you."
Without another word, Johanna silently recomposes her features into the very picture of unassuming gentility, and leaves.
"Well, I should get going. My date has yet to return with my drink, and he still needs to be convinced that he should be donating money to further a certain political club's beneficent activities."
Without another word, Johanna silently recomposes her sneering features into the very picture of elegant gentility, and leaves.
You're not certain if she's being metaphorical about those knives.
The way she says the word 'years'... it sounds like a jagged scar being reopened.
(You have gained a little peril)

"Every step I've taken since then has taken me higher. Higher in stature, higher in society, higher in peril. I have succeeded at everything I've touched. It is who I am. The fact that Armand can't see that when I'm-"
(You have gained some peril)
"What makes me think that?" She asks. "Well, for one, you've barely even gone looking for your fiancé. Otherwise you would have found him by now, non?"
"Oh, you must be Yvette!" She says with a note of surprise in her voice. "I've heard so much about you..."

Hearing a trill of laughter, you turn away from your reflection to notice that woman Johanna approaching you. She's holding onto the arm of a particularly powerful gentleman, but you can tell that she's the one guiding his steps, not the other way around. All these people, and not another soul seems to suspect the truth about her.

Hearing a trill of laughter, you turn away from your reflection to notice that woman Johanna approaching you. She's holding onto the arm of a particularly powerful gentleman, but you can tell that she's the one guiding his steps, not the other way around. All these people, and not another soul seems to suspect the truth about her.
All the same, you check a mirror to make sure that neither of your eyebrows are trying to flee their assigned positions. Thankfully, they have managed to hold steady.
As you find yourself alone again, you realize that you no longer feel too hot. Something about that encounter has left you with a chill.

(You have lost a decent amount of credibility)
(You have gained a decent amount of peril)

(You have lost a little credibility)
(You have lost a large amount of peril)

(You have lost a little credibility)
(You have lost a little peril)
(You have gained quite a bit of peril)
"No, I don't think so, Yvette. I've seen enough knives slipped into people's back to know when I shouldn't lower my guard. I'm a little too smart for that."

"Fine, I can accept that for now. As long as our circumstances don't interfere with each other's plans, we can be at least be civil." Johanna seems to visibly relax, and you can feel a certain tension drain out of the conversation.

With that, you turn and leave, at a very brisk pace. Sometimes discretion is the better part of valor, and this feels like a good time to exercise said discretion. You know that Johanna will feel like she's won this particular exchange, but that's an acceptable loss, for the moment.
"You dare try to make a fool of me?"
"Oh, is Armand's fiancée trying to extend me an olive branch?" She asks, scrutinizing you further.
"I simply don't know what to do with you."
"However, whether I like it or not, I find my thoughts drawn to you. Thinking about how quickly your star has already risen. Thinking about how achieving those very same advancements took me years."

With that he departs, leaving you alone with Johanna. The woman wastes no time stepping closer to you, her voice low. "Looking at the greater picture, I know I shouldn't be bothered by you. In fact, we should be of absolutely zero interest to each other. We're merely two women trying to make our own lives better."
"What? Oh, but of course Madame du Jardin!" The gentleman replies, seemingly oblivious.
"Oh, my glass seems to have run terribly dry." Johanna gasps in an imitation of surprise. "Monsieur, would you mind fetching me a drink?"
"It's such a pity that you're destined for disappointment in that regard."

"Excusez moi, Madame du Jardin..." the gentleman at her side interjects. "When we spoke earlier, you had described yourself as a woman of modest means. What is this talk of inheritance and greater fortunes?"

(You have lost a little credibility)
(You have lost a little peril)
"Oh, that's true, I've actually misspoken a little." She laughs breezily at the thought. "You and I are both quite aware of a few things that you certainly couldn't do without."

"Every resource I have, I clawed from the dirt of my circumstances." She hisses at you. "Do you think it was easy getting named the sole heir to what little my family had left, after they'd squandered it?"
She looks you up and down. "Yes, it does put me at ease to know that you're as unserious as I thought you to be."
"Then again, I imagine it's easier to be so ambitious when you have nothing to lose."

"Well, all things considered, you've done quite well for yourself." Johanna says, scrutinizing you carefully. "In a provincial village like yours, I can see why Armand would have taken quite a liking to you."
(You have gained some credibility back)
(You have gained some credibility back)

"Of course, didn't you manage to reveal that perfidious Marcelle woman to be a pretender to her title? Who can really trust the opinions of such a creature? I'm certain that her attacks on your character were as false as her name!"

"Of course, didn't you manage to reveal that detestable Baron to be a vile philanderer of the worst sort? Who can really trust the opinions of such a creature? I'm certain that his attacks on your character were as false as his supposed virtues!"
(You have lost a decent amount of credibility)
The gentleman with her looks over you and gasps. "I remember hearing of this! Such unfortunate business." He says with pity, which is not exactly the emotion you hoped to inspire in people tonight.

"It's such a shame to hear about how the Viscountess de Foix absolutely humiliated you in front of all of those people. I can't imagine how awful it was to endure such a vile debasement. Truly unfortunate."

"It's such a shame to hear about how the Baron De Termes absolutely humiliated you in front of all of those people. I can't imagine how awful it was to endure such a vile debasement. Truly unfortunate."
"Yvette, I can't believe that you're here!" She says with a note of excitement in her voice. "I was just telling the fine gentleman here all about you..."

Hearing a trill of laughter, you turn away from your reflection to notice that woman Johanna approaching you. She's holding onto the arm of a particularly powerful gentleman, but you can tell that she's the one guiding his steps, not the other way around.

Hearing a trill of laughter, you turn away from your reflection to notice a woman with a shining emerald around her neck approaching you. She's holding onto the arm of a particularly powerful gentleman, but you can tell that she's the one guiding his steps, not the other way around.

With a sigh of relief, you manage to find a breeze from the open doors in the vestibule. It's gotten so hot that you feel like you're going to pass out. You're absolutely certain that you've already started to sweat through your makeup.
"What makes you think I have nothing to lose?"
"I don't know either. What I do know is that I'm going to walk away."
"I can't tell if this is a threat or a romantic advance. Either way, let's get it over with."
"This doesn't need to end in open hostility Johanna, you know that, right?"
"What makes you think I have nothing to lose?"
"Spoken truly like a person who's always had resources to work with."
"It's true. I make sure that there's little in my life to weigh me down."

aDarkMirrorChurch.node.8: "Of course, didn't you manage to reveal that detestable Baron to be a vile philanderer of the worst sort? Who can really trust the opinions of such a creature? I'm certain that his attacks on your character were as false as his supposed virtues!"
aDarkMirrorChurch.node.7: (You have lost a decent amount of credibility)
aDarkMirrorChurch.node.6: The gentleman with her looks over you and gasps. "I remember hearing of this! Such unfortunate business." He says with pity, which is not exactly the emotion you hoped to inspire in people tonight.
aDarkMirrorChurch.node.5: "It's such a shame to hear about how the Viscountess de Foix absolutely humiliated you in front of all of those people. I can't imagine how awful it was to endure such a vile debasement. Truly unfortunate."
aDarkMirrorChurch.node.4: "It's such a shame to hear about how the Baron De Termes absolutely humiliated you in front of all of those people. I can't imagine how awful it was to endure such a vile debasement. Truly unfortunate."
aDarkMirrorChurch.node.3: "Yvette, I can't believe that you're here!" She says with a note of excitement in her voice. "I was just telling the fine gentleman here all about you..."
aDarkMirrorChurch.node.2: Hearing a trill of laughter, you turn away from your reflection to notice that woman Johanna approaching you. She's holding onto the arm of a particularly powerful gentleman, but you can tell that she's the one guiding his steps, not the other way around.
aDarkMirrorChurch.node.1: Hearing a trill of laughter, you turn away from your reflection to notice a woman with a shining emerald around her neck approaching you. She's holding onto the arm of a particularly powerful gentleman, but you can tell that she's the one guiding his steps, not the other way around.
aDarkMirrorChurch.node.0: With a sigh of relief, you manage to find a breeze from a nearby open door. It's gotten so hot that you feel like you're going to pass out. You're absolutely certain that you've already started to sweat through your makeup.
aDarkMirrorChurch.link.43: "What makes you think I have nothing to lose?"
aDarkMirrorChurch.link.23: "I don't know either. What I do know is that I'm going to walk away."
aDarkMirrorChurch.link.22: "I can't tell if this is a threat or a romantic advance. Either way, let's get it over with."
aDarkMirrorChurch.link.21: "This doesn't need to end in open hostility Johanna, you know that, right?"
aDarkMirrorChurch.link.13: "What makes you think I have nothing to lose?"
aDarkMirrorChurch.link.12: "Spoken truly like a person who's always had resources to work with."
aDarkMirrorChurch.link.11: "It's true. I make sure that there's little in my life to weigh me down."
aDarkMirrorMilitary.name: A Dark Mirror
aDarkMirrorMilitary.description: You’re approached by a woman wearing a green emerald about her neck, and something about her feels wholly too familiar. Is it because she seems to know so much about your past, or is it... something else?
aDarkMirrorMilitary.node.50: "Every step I've taken since then has taken me higher. Higher in stature, higher in society, higher in peril. I have succeeded at everything I've touched. It is who I am. The fact that Armand refused to see that when I'm-"
aDarkMirrorMilitary.node.49: (You have gained a decent amount of credibility)
aDarkMirrorMilitary.node.48: "Oh.. oh, well played." Johanna says with a sudden smile. "I'll be certain to stay on my toes around you."
aDarkMirrorMilitary.node.47: Without another word, Johanna silently recomposes her features into the very picture of unassuming gentility, and leaves.
aDarkMirrorMilitary.node.46: "Well, I should get going. My date has yet to return with my drink, and he still needs to be convinced that he should be donating money to further a certain political club's beneficent activities."
aDarkMirrorMilitary.node.45: Without another word, Johanna silently recomposes her sneering features into the very picture of elegant gentility, and leaves.
aDarkMirrorMilitary.node.44: You're not certain if she's being metaphorical about those knives.
aDarkMirrorMilitary.node.43: The way she says the word 'years'... it sounds like a jagged scar being reopened.
aDarkMirrorMilitary.node.41: "Every step I've taken since then has taken me higher. Higher in stature, higher in society, higher in peril. I have succeeded at everything I've touched. It is who I am. The fact that Armand can't see that when I'm-"
aDarkMirrorMilitary.node.39: "What makes me think that?" She asks. "Well, for one, you've barely even gone looking for your fiancé. Otherwise you would have found him by now, non?"
aDarkMirrorMilitary.node.38: "Oh, you must be Yvette!" She says with a note of surprise in her voice. "I've heard so much about you..."
aDarkMirrorMilitary.node.37: Hearing a trill of laughter, you turn away from your reflection to notice that woman Johanna approaching you. She's holding onto the arm of a particularly powerful gentleman, but you can tell that she's the one guiding his steps, not the other way around. All these people, and not another soul seems to suspect the truth about her.
aDarkMirrorMilitary.node.36: Hearing a trill of laughter, you turn away from your reflection to notice that woman Johanna approaching you. She's holding onto the arm of a particularly powerful gentleman, but you can tell that she's the one guiding his steps, not the other way around. All these people, and not another soul seems to suspect the truth about her.
aDarkMirrorMilitary.node.35: All the same, you'd like to check a mirror to make sure that neither of your eyebrows are trying to flee their assigned positions.
aDarkMirrorMilitary.node.34: As you find yourself alone again, you realize that you no longer feel too hot. Something about that encounter has left you with a chill.
aDarkMirrorMilitary.node.33:
(You have lost a decent amount of credibility)

(You have lost a little credibility)

aDarkMirrorMilitary.node.30: (You have gained quite a bit of peril)
aDarkMirrorMilitary.node.29: "No, I don't think so, Yvette. I've seen enough knives slipped into people's back to know when I shouldn't lower my guard. I'm a little too smart for that."
aDarkMirrorMilitary.node.28: "Fine, I can accept that for now. As long as our circumstances don't interfere with each other's plans, we can be at least be civil." Johanna seems to visibly relax, and you can feel a certain tension drain out of the conversation.
aDarkMirrorMilitary.node.27: With that, you turn and leave, at a very brisk pace. Sometimes discretion is the better part of valor, and this feels like a good time to exercise said discretion. You know that Johanna will feel like she's won this particular exchange, but that's an acceptable loss, for the moment.
aDarkMirrorMilitary.node.26: "You dare try to make a fool of me?"
aDarkMirrorMilitary.node.25: "Oh, is Armand's fiancée trying to extend me an olive branch?" She asks, scrutinizing you further.
aDarkMirrorMilitary.node.24: "I simply don't know what to do with you."
aDarkMirrorMilitary.node.23: "However, whether I like it or not, I find my thoughts drawn to you. Thinking about how quickly your star has already risen. Thinking about how achieving those very same advancements took me years."
aDarkMirrorMilitary.node.22: With that he departs, leaving you alone with Johanna. The woman wastes no time stepping closer to you, her voice low. "Looking at the greater picture, I know I shouldn't be bothered by you. In fact, we should be of absolutely zero interest to each other. We're merely two women trying to make our own lives better."
aDarkMirrorMilitary.node.21: "What? Oh, but of course Madame du Jardin!" The gentleman replies, seemingly oblivious.
aDarkMirrorMilitary.node.20: "Oh, my glass seems to have run terribly dry." Johanna gasps in an imitation of surprise. "Monsieur, would you mind fetching me a drink?"
aDarkMirrorMilitary.node.19: "It's such a pity that you're destined for disappointment in that regard."
aDarkMirrorMilitary.node.18: "Excusez moi, Madame du Jardin..." the gentleman at her side interjects. "When we spoke earlier, you had described yourself as a woman of modest means. What is this talk of inheritance and greater fortunes?"
aDarkMirrorMilitary.node.17:
(You have lost a little credibility)

aDarkMirrorMilitary.node.16: "Oh, that's true, I've actually misspoken a little." She laughs breezily at the thought. "You and I are both quite aware of a few things that you certainly couldn't do without."
aDarkMirrorMilitary.node.15: "Every resource I have, I clawed from the dirt of my circumstances." She hisses at you. "Do you think it was easy getting named the sole heir to what little my family had left, after they'd squandered it?"
aDarkMirrorMilitary.node.14: She looks you up and down. "Yes, it does put me at ease to know that you're as unserious as I thought you to be."
aDarkMirrorMilitary.node.13: "Then again, I imagine it's easier to be so ambitious when you have nothing to lose."

madameMirrorCrown.name: Madame Mirror
madameMirrorCrown.description: Why is there a woman here who looks so much like you?
madameMirrorCrown.node.33: "Ah, I didn't realize you were so ahead of the times..." The banker replies, having clearly found himself in uncertain territory, and looking to drop his original question as soon as possible.
madameMirrorCrown.node.32: "It marks important turning points in the evening, with the same visual splendor as a lighthouse seen from a great distance, after many days at sea! Believe me, it will be all the rage, soon enough!"
madameMirrorCrown.node.31: "Madame Decaux has taken to changing outfits at key points of the night, in keeping with the latest trends from the wealthy free women in my home of Saint-Domingue!"
madameMirrorCrown.node.30: "Oh, it's quite simple you see..." Maurice begins, as he joins you at your side.
madameMirrorCrown.node.28:
He hurries away nervously, which seems good until you realize that he's still planning on trying to negotiate some kind of massive loan with you. 

The kind you can't possibly afford.
madameMirrorCrown.node.27: However, your first real priority is finding this mysterious woman who is pretending to be you.
madameMirrorCrown.node.26: You try to dismiss the thought but he's turned out to be quite insistent. Which makes sense, as anyone loaning money with a high interest rate is secretly hoping that you'll never be able to fully pay them back. Why else would they do it?
madameMirrorCrown.node.25: Talking with him a bit longer, you manage to both excuse yourself and convince him that you need a more time to think on this positively life ruining decision.
madameMirrorCrown.node.24: He talks with you a while longer, and it appears that he already intends to loan you a large sum of money. A sum so large that you couldn't possibly pay it back.
madameMirrorCrown.node.23: "Madame, I'm sorry, but I need to leave immediately. We'll have to discuss your loans later." He replies, attempting to sound serious, but you can hear an undertone of panic in his voice.
madameMirrorCrown.node.22: "Why the only reason you'd ask that is... Oh no!"
madameMirrorCrown.node.21: "Then... if you aren't the one I spoke with then..."
madameMirrorCrown.node.20:
(You have gained some credibility)
(You have gained some peril)
madameMirrorCrown.node.19: "What you were wearing?" He replies, feigning indulgent humor. "Such a curious question. Why would you ask that?"
madameMirrorCrown.node.17: "Uh... you look absolutely magnifique!" He replies, obviously caught offguard by your question. "It was quite the bold choice to change clothes in the middle of an event. Though a touch unusual, now that I consider it..."
madameMirrorCrown.node.16: (You have lost a decent amount of credibility)
madameMirrorCrown.node.14: "If I may be so bold as to ask, why did you change your outfit?"
madameMirrorCrown.node.13: He steps back and looks you up and down, puzzled by something.
madameMirrorCrown.node.12: "Madame, are you serious? Have you forgotten about our deal already? I'm trusting you at your word with a princely sum of money. Please don't make me regret my trust."
madameMirrorCrown.node.11: "As I was saying, you approached me earlier in the evening and said that you were interested in borrowing a substantial amount of money. Of course, the interest rate will be significant, but you've already convinced me that this isn't worth worrying about."
madameMirrorCrown.node.8: "I'm glad to hear that you have everything in order! So many of my clients usually decide to barrage me with ceaseless questions."
madameMirrorCrown.node.7: "Are you serious? We just talked about this earlier today, Madame Yvette."
madameMirrorCrown.node.6: "You what?" He hisses at you. "Madame! Do not embarrass me in front of this many notable clients. This isn't a time for joking."
madameMirrorCrown.node.5: He pauses to examine you for a moment, which makes sense. That lie could have been a little more confident.
madameMirrorCrown.node.4: You have no idea who the devil this is.
madameMirrorCrown.node.3: "Ah, Madame Decaux, I'm pleased to see you again! Would you be willing to indulge me for a moment, so we might be able to discuss our business again? You still remember everything we went over, non?"
madameMirrorCrown.node.2: You walk over to inspect said mirror, but you're interrupted by someone in the middle of your approach.
madameMirrorCrown.node.1:
At first, you thought that you had been looking in a mirror, but something was simply off about the whole thing. 

How odd.
madameMirrorCrown.node.0: While circling the party, you happen to notice something very strange.
madameMirrorCrown.link.34: "Well, ah... why don't I allow my tailor Maurice to explain that?"
madameMirrorCrown.link.21: " Excusez-moi, but what was I wearing before?"
madameMirrorCrown.link.20: "Monsieur, I can assure you that I haven't changed my clothes."
madameMirrorCrown.link.19: "Better yet, what do you think of it?"
madameMirrorCrown.link.6: "I'm sorry, can you remind me of our business again?"
madameMirrorCrown.link.5: "Monsieur, I have no idea who you are."
madameMirrorCrown.link.4: "Ah, but of course! The business that we did... which I know so much about!"

madameMirrorRevolution.name: Madame Mirror
madameMirrorRevolution.description: Why is there a woman here who looks so much like you?
madameMirrorRevolution.node.33: "Ah, I didn't realize you were so ahead of the times..." The banker replies, having clearly found himself in uncertain territory, and looking to drop his original question as soon as possible.
madameMirrorRevolution.node.32: "It marks important turning points in the evening, with the same visual splendor as a lighthouse seen from a great distance, after many days at sea! Believe me, it will be all the rage, soon enough!"
madameMirrorRevolution.node.31: "Madame Decaux has taken to changing outfits at key points of the night, in keeping with the latest trends from the wealthy free women in my home of Saint-Domingue!"
madameMirrorRevolution.node.30: "Oh, it's quite simple you see..." Maurice begins, as he joins you at your side.
madameMirrorRevolution.node.28:
He hurries away nervously, which seems good until you realize that he's still planning on trying to negotiate some kind of massive loan with you. 

The kind you can't possibly afford.
madameMirrorRevolution.node.27: However, your first real priority is finding this mysterious woman who is pretending to be you.
madameMirrorRevolution.node.26: You try to dismiss the thought but he's turned out to be quite insistent. Which makes sense, as anyone loaning money with a high interest rate is secretly hoping that you'll never be able to fully pay them back. Why else would they do it?
madameMirrorRevolution.node.25: Talking with him a bit longer, you manage to both excuse yourself and convince him that you need a more time to think on this positively life ruining decision.
madameMirrorRevolution.node.24: He talks with you a while longer, and it appears that he already intends to loan you a large sum of money. A sum so large that you couldn't possibly pay it back.
madameMirrorRevolution.node.23: "Madame, I'm sorry, but I need to leave immediately. We'll have to discuss your loans later." He replies, attempting to sound serious, but you can hear an undertone of panic in his voice.
madameMirrorRevolution.node.22: "Why the only reason you'd ask that is... Oh no!"
madameMirrorRevolution.node.21: "Then... if you aren't the one I spoke with then..."

anImpostorCrown.name: An Impostor
anImpostorCrown.description: You catch sight of the strange doppelganger that you spotted before. The time has come to put an end to this loathsome charade.
anImpostorCrown.node.67: Before you can get a chance to reply, she steps backwards into the crowd, and disappears. You look high and low, but can't seem to find her.
anImpostorCrown.node.66: You scowl at the space where your impostor used to be. Now you have nothing she's managed to acquired, and she's still out there ruining your good name.
anImpostorCrown.node.64: (You have gained a piece of Shocking Crown Gossip)
anImpostorCrown.node.63: She leaves, and you're quite a bit richer for it. There's also the true benefit, which is that she's no longer sneaking about Paris, sullying your good name.
anImpostorCrown.node.62: "I guess I should be on my way then." She says, looking you up and down. "It wouldn't do for the two of us to be seen together."
anImpostorCrown.node.61:
(You have gained a piece of Shocking Crown Gossip)
(You have gained 73 Livres)
anImpostorCrown.node.60: She pulls a sizable coin purse from her waist pockets, and hands it to you. She then proceeds to explain a rumor that could be valuable indeed.
anImpostorCrown.node.59: "If I did that, I'd lose everything I've gained? Absolutely not."
anImpostorCrown.node.58: "I suppose this couldn't last forever. C'est la vie."
anImpostorCrown.node.57: "I managed to collect some money from sympathetic nobles, and I've heard an interesting secret, but those bank loans never came through for some reason."
anImpostorCrown.node.56: Your impostor pulls a sizable coin purse from her waist pockets and gives it to you. "Here it is. The loans never went through, but I managed to get by on the sympathy of a few wealthy nobles."
anImpostorCrown.node.55: "I see. Fine then. Madame Decaux, here's what I've learned while pretending to be you..." She then proceeds to explain a rumor that could be valuable indeed.
anImpostorCrown.node.53: "So, what exactly do you want from me?"
anImpostorCrown.node.52: Of course, the first thing she did with this second chance was to try and take out a mountain of loans in your name, but she seems to be willing to gloss over that important detail.
anImpostorCrown.node.51: "I realized one day how much I looked like you and thought 'She was given a second chance. Why don't I deserve one too?'"

anImpostorCrown.node.37: You clear your throat politely, and step into the circle of conversation.
anImpostorCrown.node.36: You nod to him, and he steps back into the shadows. Glancing around the party, you check to see if there's anything else you can get done before this thing wraps up.
anImpostorCrown.node.35: "Good to have that solved, eh madame?" Hansel asks you with a smile.
anImpostorCrown.node.34: With that done, she goes to say something else, but thinks better of it, and leaves.
anImpostorCrown.node.32: Your impostor pulls a sizable coin purse from her waist pockets and gives it to you. "Here it is. The loans never went through, but I managed to get by on the sympathy of a few wealthy nobles."
anImpostorCrown.node.31: "Please, I guess I can give you the money, but please you have to let me keep doing this. You have no idea how lucky you are to-"

anImpostorCrown.node.29: She goes to argue, but Hansel's glaring countenance brooks no argument.
anImpostorCrown.node.28: "Do not try my employer's patience. Either you stop impersonating Madame Decaux, or I will personally remove any resemblance you have to her."

anImpostorCrown.node.22: "Perhaps, I should leave this discussion to the two of you." The party guest says, already slinking away from you both.
anImpostorCrown.node.21: The impostor whirls around to see you, and is greeted by your glaring countenance.
anImpostorCrown.node.20: "It is... how do I say... it's you, Madame?"
anImpostorCrown.node.18: "Uh, Madame Decaux... there appears to be someone behind you."
anImpostorCrown.node.17: "You want all of the money I made? I worked hard for these livres."
anImpostorCrown.node.16: "If that's what you want, I can tell you about a valuable rumor I heard." She sighs. "Please consider, however, letting me keep this charade up. I need this. I can't just stop now."
anImpostorCrown.node.15: "Yvette, do you have any idea how lucky you are?" The impostor asks. "People are ruined by Parisian high society every day, but you happened to be ruined a way that actually gave you opportunities. I need this. I can't just stop now."
anImpostorCrown.node.14: "Well, this is a bit much." Your double replies, holding up her hands in a universal sign of surrender. "What exactly, do you want from me?"
anImpostorCrown.node.13: Hansel steps out from the shadows behind you. "I wouldn't enjoy it, but I'm willing to do it. Just give the order, Madame Decaux."
anImpostorCrown.node.12: "Oh, well I..." She starts, obviously a little blindsided by your offer. "I've earned some coin and people have told me an interesting secret that I can't really do anything with."
anImpostorCrown.node.11: "Well then, at least let me explain myself." She replies calmly. "You're an incredibly lucky woman. People are ruined by Parisian high society every day, but you happened to be ruined in a way that actually gave you opportunities."
anImpostorCrown.node.10: "I don't suppose it's too late to say you have the wrong woman?"

anImpostorMilitary.name: An Impostor
anImpostorMilitary.description: You catch sight of the strange doppelganger that you spotted before. The time has come to put an end to this loathsome charade.
anImpostorMilitary.node.67: Before you can get a chance to reply, she steps backwards into the crowd, and disappears. You look high and low, but can't seem to find her.
anImpostorMilitary.node.66: You scowl at the space where your impostor used to be. Now you have nothing she's managed to acquired, and she's still out there ruining your good name.
anImpostorMilitary.node.64: (You have gained a piece of Shocking Military Gossip)
anImpostorMilitary.node.63: She leaves, and you're quite a bit richer for it. There's also the true benefit, which is that she's no longer sneaking about Paris, sullying your good name.
anImpostorMilitary.node.62: "I guess I should be on my way then." She says, looking you up and down. "It wouldn't do for the two of us to be seen together."
anImpostorMilitary.node.61:
(You have gained a piece of Shocking Military Gossip)
(You have gained 73 Livres)
anImpostorMilitary.node.60: She pulls a sizable coin purse from her waist pockets, and hands it to you. She then proceeds to explain a rumor that could be valuable indeed.
anImpostorMilitary.node.59: "If I did that, I'd lose everything I've gained? Absolutely not."
anImpostorMilitary.node.58: "I suppose this couldn't last forever. C'est la vie."
anImpostorMilitary.node.57: "I managed to collect some money from sympathetic nobles, and I've heard an interesting secret, but those bank loans never came through for some reason."
anImpostorMilitary.node.56: Your impostor pulls a sizable coin purse from her waist pockets and gives it to you. "Here it is. The loans never went through, but I managed to get by on the sympathy of a few wealthy nobles."
anImpostorMilitary.node.55: "I see. Fine then. Madame Decaux, here's what I've learned while pretending to be you..." She then proceeds to explain a rumor that could be valuable indeed.
anImpostorMilitary.node.53: "So, what exactly do you want from me?"
anImpostorMilitary.node.52: Of course, the first thing she did with this second chance was to try and take out a mountain of loans in your name, but she seems to be willing to gloss over that important detail.
anImpostorMilitary.node.51: "I realized one day how much I looked like you and thought 'She was given a second chance. Why don't I deserve one too?'"
anImpostorMilitary.node.50: With her gone, you look around the party to see if there's anything else you can get done here before things wrap up.

(You have lost quite a bit of credibility)
(You have gained a decent amount of peril)

anImpostorMilitary.node.42: "Fine, you win. I'll leave this behind, I promise. Please just leave me be."
anImpostorMilitary.node.41: (You have gained a piece of Shocking Military Gossip)
anImpostorMilitary.node.40: "I see. Fine then. Madame Decaux, here's what I've learned while pretending to be you..." She then proceeds to explain a rumor that could be valuable indeed.
anImpostorMilitary.node.39: You say nothing. Instead you merely sip your wine and look to your impostor patiently. Let her make the first move.
anImpostorMilitary.node.38: "Who are... how are there... what's going on?"
anImpostorMilitary.node.37: You clear your throat politely, and step into the circle of conversation.
anImpostorMilitary.node.36: You nod to him, and he steps back into the shadows. Glancing around the party, you check to see if there's anything else you can get done before this thing wraps up.
anImpostorMilitary.node.35: "Good to have that solved, eh madame?" Hansel asks you with a smile.
anImpostorMilitary.node.34: With that done, she goes to say something else, but thinks better of it, and leaves.
anImpostorMilitary.node.32: Your impostor pulls a sizable coin purse from her waist pockets and gives it to you. "Here it is. The loans never went through, but I managed to get by on the sympathy of a few wealthy nobles."
anImpostorMilitary.node.31: "Please, I guess I can give you the money, but please you have to let me keep doing this. You have no idea how lucky you are to-"
anImpostorMilitary.node.30: Well, she worked hard for it, using your identity and reputation.
anImpostorMilitary.node.29: She goes to argue, but Hansel's glaring countenance brooks no argument.
anImpostorMilitary.node.28: "Do not try my employer's patience. Either you stop impersonating Madame Decaux, or I will personally remove any resemblance you have to her."
anImpostorMilitary.node.27: She goes to argue, but Hansel's glaring countenance brooks no argument.
anImpostorMilitary.node.26: "Do not try my employer's patience. Either you stop impersonating Madame Decaux, or I will personally remove any resemblance you have to her."
anImpostorMilitary.node.25: She goes to argue, but Hansel's glaring countenance brooks no argument.
anImpostorMilitary.node.24: "Do not try my employer's patience. Either you stop impersonating Madame Decaux, or I will personally remove any resemblance you have to her."
anImpostorMilitary.node.23: With that, he skulks away, leaving you with your double. The impostor looks you up and down, but doesn't even seem perturbed by your presence. Or, at least, she is doing a great job of hiding it.
anImpostorMilitary.node.22: "Perhaps, I should leave this discussion to the two of you." The party guest says, already slinking away from you both.
anImpostorMilitary.node.21: The impostor whirls around to see you, and is greeted by your glaring countenance.
anImpostorMilitary.node.20: "It is... how do I say... it's you, Madame?"
anImpostorMilitary.node.18: "Uh, Madame Decaux... there appears to be someone behind you."
anImpostorMilitary.node.17: "You want all of the money I made? I worked hard for these livres."
anImpostorMilitary.node.16: "If that's what you want, I can tell you about a valuable rumor I heard." She sighs. "Please consider, however, letting me keep this charade up. I need this. I can't just stop now."
anImpostorMilitary.node.15: "Yvette, do you have any idea how lucky you are?" The impostor asks. "People are ruined by Parisian high society every day, but you happened to be ruined a way that actually gave you opportunities. I need this. I can't just stop now."
anImpostorMilitary.node.14: "Well, this is a bit much." Your double replies, holding up her hands in a universal sign of surrender. "What exactly, do you want from me?"
anImpostorMilitary.node.13: Hansel steps out from the shadows behind you. "I wouldn't enjoy it, but I'm willing to do it. Just give the order, Madame Decaux."
anImpostorMilitary.node.12: "Oh, well I..." She starts, obviously a little blindsided by your offer. "I've earned some coin and people have told me an interesting secret that I can't really do anything with."
anImpostorMilitary.node.11: "Well then, at least let me explain myself." She replies calmly. "You're an incredibly lucky woman. People are ruined by Parisian high society every day, but you happened to be ruined in a way that actually gave you opportunities."
anImpostorMilitary.node.10: "I don't suppose it's too late to say you have the wrong woman?"
anImpostorMilitary.node.9: Once you release her, your double spins to face you, and looks you up and down. Strangely, she doesn't even seem perturbed by your presence. Or, at least, she's doing a great job of hiding it.
anImpostorMilitary.node.8: "Well, I have to admit that I've been extremely busy since I arrived in Paris. So many people have offered me their help, and it's been wonderful to take them up on their generosity."
anImpostorMilitary.node.7: "Well, I have to admit that I've been extremely busy since I arrived in Paris. So many people have offered me their help, and it's been wonderful to take them up on their generosity."

anImpostorRevolution.node.23: With that, he skulks away, leaving you with your double. The impostor looks you up and down, but doesn't even seem perturbed by your presence. Or, at least, she is doing a great job of hiding it.
anImpostorRevolution.node.22: "Perhaps, I should leave this discussion to the two of you." The party guest says, already slinking away from you both.
anImpostorRevolution.node.21: The impostor whirls around to see you, and is greeted by your glaring countenance.
anImpostorRevolution.node.20: "It is... how do I say... it's you, Madame?"
anImpostorRevolution.node.18: "Uh, Madame Decaux... there appears to be someone behind you."
anImpostorRevolution.node.17: "You want all of the money I made? I worked hard for these livres."
anImpostorRevolution.node.16: "If that's what you want, I can tell you about a valuable rumor I heard." She sighs. "Please consider, however, letting me keep this charade up. I need this. I can't just stop now."
anImpostorRevolution.node.15: "Yvette, do you have any idea how lucky you are?" The impostor asks.  "People are ruined by Parisian high society every day, but you happened to be ruined a way that actually gave you opportunities. I need this. I can't just stop now."
anImpostorRevolution.node.14: "Well, this is a bit much." Your double replies, holding up her hands in a universal sign of surrender. "What exactly, do you want from me?"
anImpostorRevolution.node.13: Hansel steps out from the shadows behind you. "I wouldn't enjoy it, but I'm willing to do it. Just give the order, Madame Decaux."
anImpostorRevolution.node.12: "Oh, well I..." She starts, obviously a little blindsided by your offer. "I've earned some coin and people have told me an interesting secret that I can't really do anything with."
anImpostorRevolution.node.11: "Well then, at least let me explain myself." She replies calmly. "You're an incredibly lucky woman. People are ruined by Parisian high society every day, but you happened to be ruined in a way that actually gave you opportunities."
anImpostorRevolution.node.10: "I don't suppose it's too late to say you have the wrong woman?"
anImpostorRevolution.node.9: Once you release her, your double spins to face you, and looks you up and down. Strangely, she doesn't even seem perturbed by your presence. Or, at least, she's doing a great job of hiding it.
anImpostorRevolution.node.8: "Well, I have to admit that I've been extremely busy since I arrived in Paris. So many people have offered me their help, and it's been wonderful to take them up on their generosity."
anImpostorRevolution.node.7: "Well, I have to admit that I've been extremely busy since I arrived in Paris. So many people have offered me their help, and it's been wonderful to take them up on their generosity."
anImpostorRevolution.node.6: The woman your double is talking with notices you first, and looks quite startled by your sudden appearance, but you don't bother with her. Instead you take this impostor by the elbow. Gently, but firmly, you lead her away to a different section of the party.
anImpostorRevolution.node.5: You walk up to her quickly and quietly, finding her engaged in conversation with another party guest. Their discussion seems agreeable, and now that you're this close, you have to admit that her resemblance to you is absolutely uncanny.
anImpostorRevolution.node.4: "Ah, it's so lovely to finally meet you, Madame Decaux!" Says the guest speaking with the impostor. Now that you're closer to your double, you have to admit that her resemblance to you is uncanny.
anImpostorRevolution.node.3: "Ah, it's so lovely to finally meet you, Madame Decaux!" Says the guest speaking with the impostor. Now that you're closer to your double, you have to admit that her resemblance to you is uncanny.
anImpostorRevolution.node.2: Now you've spotted her talking to another party guest, but she hasn't noticed you yet.
anImpostorRevolution.node.1: Ever since your last encounter, you've been looking for her. This is the woman who has been imitating you, and even had the audacity to try taking out a vast loan in your name.
anImpostorRevolution.node.0: You freeze in your tracks when you spot her.
anImpostorRevolution.link.58: "What does anyone want? Money, I want money."
anImpostorRevolution.link.57: "Information. Give me everything you've learned by pretending to be me."
anImpostorRevolution.link.56: "I want the rumors, the coin, and for you to stop pretending to be me."
anImpostorRevolution.link.16: "What does anyone want? Money, I want money."
anImpostorRevolution.link.15: "Information. Give me everything you've learned by pretending to be me."
anImpostorRevolution.link.14: "All I want is for you to end this charade, and to stop damaging my reputation."
anImpostorRevolution.link.12: "Hansel, are you willing to strike a woman?"
anImpostorRevolution.link.11: "Let's cut to the quick. What would you give me if I simply let you keep doing this?"
anImpostorRevolution.link.10: "Yes, it's a little late for that."
lostCoinCrown.name: Lost Coin
lostCoinCrown.description: A chambermaid has been charged with returning a lost pouch of coins. Perhaps you can ‘assist’ her with such an endeavor.
lostCoinCrown.node.22:
(You have gained a little credibility)
(You have reduced your peril a tiny bit)
lostCoinCrown.node.19:
(You have lost some credibility)
(You have gained some peril)
lostCoinCrown.node.18: "Pardonnez-moi, madame. I found this wallet while I was tidying up. I took it to my employer, but they don't recognize it. I've been told not to rest until the owner is found."
lostCoinCrown.node.17: After a few second of bluster, she calms down. "I suppose you're right. If we make a circuit of the party together, we might be able to find the owner this time."
lostCoinCrown.node.16: Before the chambermaid can ask you any more questions, you excuse yourself and leave to investigate the rest of the party.
lostCoinCrown.node.15: She hands you the wallet, and curtsies politely. You make a great show of thumbing through this mysterious wallet to make sure that everything is there.
lostCoinCrown.node.14: With a polite nod, you excuse yourself and leave to explore the rest of the party.
lostCoinCrown.node.13:
With a fake smile, the chambermaid curtsies politely and leaves. 

Muttering a choice selection of curses, you decide to investigate the rest of the party.
lostCoinCrown.node.12: "However, if I am mistaken, you may consult our host and have it returned to you." A task which you both know that you will not attempt.
lostCoinCrown.node.11: Eventually, you come upon a man who recognizes it immediately. "Oh, thank you so much! I hadn't even realized I'd misplaced it." Some of the nearby guests murmur approvingly of your honesty.
lostCoinCrown.node.10: The two of you check the party together, looking for the owner of the mysterious wallet.
lostCoinCrown.node.9: The Chambermaid glowers at you. "Madame, I must admit that I find this hard to believe, given that this is obviously a man's wallet."
lostCoinCrown.node.8: "Oh, well I'm glad I found you." She mumbles, obviously disappointed.
lostCoinCrown.node.7: With an exchange of smiles, the chambermaid curtsies politely and leaves. Feeling reinvigorated, you decide to investigate the rest of the party.
lostCoinCrown.node.6: The two of you split the money found in the wallet, and the chambermaid tucks the emptied article into her bodice. "I can't imagine anyone careless enough to leave this lying around will mind too much." She says with a shrug.
lostCoinCrown.node.5: "Madame, where could you have gotten that idea?" She replies, eyes darting about.
lostCoinCrown.node.4: "Oh madame, you're absolutely right! I can't believe I forgot!" She replies, with outrageously feigned surprise.
lostCoinCrown.node.2: "Do you know who this might belong to? Otherwise..."
lostCoinCrown.node.1: While you're composing yourself, a chambermaid approaches you. She's holding a small, unmarked pouch of coins.
lostCoinCrown.node.0: Feeling the need to take a quick break, you step away from the crowds, and take a moment to just breathe.
lostCoinCrown.link.3: "I understand that you'd like to split it, but we should find the real owner."
lostCoinCrown.link.2: "I can only assume that half of it is mine, and the other half yours."
lostCoinCrown.link.1: "Mon Dieu, I'm so glad you found my wallet!"
