looseLipsCrown.name: Loose Lips
looseLipsCrown.description: A guest has apparently been entrusted with valuable knowledge, only to make the mistake of getting extremely drunk afterwards. A single chambermaid has been told to watch over him, but you’ve never been one to let such a petty obstacle get in your way.
looseLipsCrown.node.25: He stumbles away, continuing to glare at you with such ferocity that he only narrowly avoids colliding with some other guests. Not exactly the sort of man you expected to outwit you, but... c'est la vie, eh?
looseLipsCrown.node.24: (You have lost a decent amount of credibility)
looseLipsCrown.node.23: He then proceeds to explain the entire secret that's been entrusted to him.
looseLipsCrown.node.22:
You wave to him as he departs. If nothing else, he's right about one thing. It is a good night.

A good night, indeed.
looseLipsCrown.node.21: "However, I must take my leave, madame. For some reason, I've been taken with a powerful urge to sit and rest for a while. "Goodnight!"
looseLipsCrown.node.20: Why in fact, you do see. You see quite well.
looseLipsCrown.node.19: "... of course, I can never tell anyone about such affairs. It would truly be a disaster if such secrets came to light, you see?"
looseLipsCrown.node.18: (You have gained a piece of Cheap Crown Gossip)
looseLipsCrown.node.17: As you ply the man with drink, you carefully maneuver him around the party, to make sure that the chambermaid never finds him while you go about your work. "Indeed, it's a night fit for celebration. Only just recently have the hosts brought me further into their circle of trust. In fact, you wouldn't believe the goings-on that I'm privy to..."
looseLipsCrown.node.15: You take a deep sip of the brandy, and nearly cough it up. That is far stronger than you expected. You've also started to notice that more than a few guests are glaring at you.
looseLipsCrown.node.14: "A toast!" He yells. "To the health of our hosts, and to new friends!"
looseLipsCrown.node.12: Perhaps there's something else for you to do here.
looseLipsCrown.node.11: Regardless, you leave him behind to attend to your own business. You have better things to do than play coy with a moronic drunk. Thankfully, some of the other guests seem to approve of your unwillingess to get involved with such antics.
looseLipsCrown.node.10: It isn't long before you manage to get two glasses of brandy for yourselves, from a servant who clearly hasn't been informed of your new acquaintance's state yet.
looseLipsCrown.node.9: "It's a matter requiring great secrecy!" He says, glaring at you with all of the willpower that he can summon.
looseLipsCrown.node.8: "Well, it's very important really. Only just recently have the hosts brought me further into their circle of trust. I know they're a touch unsure about my discretion, but they'll soon see that I can keep this secret, among others."
looseLipsCrown.node.7: "Well, nobody asked you." The man replies, as if everyone in the entire building couldn't hear him.
looseLipsCrown.node.6: "Ah yes, finally a young lady that understands!" He cheers, as you take him by the elbow and gently lead him away. Up close, you realize that several of his coat buttons have been buttoned into the wrong hole.
looseLipsCrown.node.5: Someone calls out to the chambermaid, and she looks behind her, towards some new disaster in the process of unfolding. In a panic, she leaves her charge while heading towards this latest problem. As she's leaving, she calls out over her shoulder "Please monsieur, just stay here and find some water!"
looseLipsCrown.node.4: "What is it? Well, it's..." He stares off into space, squinting as if he was trying to read a book that had been placed very far away from him.
looseLipsCrown.node.3: "Water, that base drink? It rusts steel! Water, for a man of my knowledge..."
looseLipsCrown.node.2: "I'm sorry, monsieur, but I'm on strict orders from the lady of the house to ensure that you are not... overserved. I simply cannot get you another drink."
looseLipsCrown.node.1: "Ah, today is a grand day, is it not? I've been entru... been entru... I've been let in on such amazing things by our hosts. You'll see. You'll all see! Their trust in my discretion was not misplaced!"
looseLipsCrown.node.0: Taking another turn of the party, you come across a beleaguered chambermaid attempting to contain a guest who is clearly far too deep into his cups.
looseLipsCrown.link.6: "I'm certain you know much, but I have other things to attend to."
looseLipsCrown.link.5: "Water? Non, that simply won't do! Let's find you something stronger."
looseLipsCrown.link.2: "Pardon monsieur, but that sounds so important. Whatever could it be?"

looseLipsChurch.node.10: It isn't long before you manage to get two glasses of brandy for yourselves, from a servant who clearly hasn't been informed of your new acquaintance's state yet.
looseLipsChurch.node.9: "It's a matter requiring great secrecy!" He says, glaring at you with all of the willpower that he can summon.
looseLipsChurch.node.8: "Well, it's very important really. Only just recently have the hosts brought me further into their circle of trust. I know they're a touch unsure about my discretion, but they'll soon see that I can keep this secret, among others."
looseLipsChurch.node.7: "Well, nobody asked you." The man replies, as if everyone in the entire building couldn't hear him.
looseLipsChurch.node.6: "Ah yes, finally a young lady that understands!" He cheers, as you take him by the elbow and gently lead him away. Up close, you realize that several of his coat buttons have been buttoned into the wrong hole.
looseLipsChurch.node.5: Someone calls out to the chambermaid, and she looks behind her, towards some new disaster in the process of unfolding. In a panic, she leaves her charge while heading towards this latest problem. As she's leaving, she calls out over her shoulder "Please monsieur, just stay here and find some water!"
looseLipsChurch.node.4: "What is it? Well, it's..." He stares off into space, squinting as if he was trying to read a book that had been placed very far away from him.
looseLipsChurch.node.3: "Water, that base drink? It rusts steel! Water, for a man of my knowledge..."
looseLipsChurch.node.2: "I'm sorry, monsieur, but I'm on strict orders from the lady of the house to ensure that you are not... overserved. I simply cannot get you another drink."
looseLipsChurch.node.1: "Ah, today is a grand day, is it not? I've been entru... been entru... I've been let in on such amazing things by our hosts. You'll see. You'll all see! Their trust in my discretion was not misplaced!"
looseLipsChurch.node.0: Taking another turn of the party, you come across a beleaguered chambermaid attempting to contain a guest who is clearly far too deep into his cups.
looseLipsChurch.link.6: "I'm certain you know much, but I have other things to attend to."
looseLipsChurch.link.5: "Water? Non, that simply won't do! Let's find you something stronger."
looseLipsChurch.link.2: "Pardon monsieur, but that sounds so important. Whatever could it be?"

makingDealsCrown.name: Making Deals
makingDealsCrown.description: You happen across Jakov Mirkovic, the liquor importer, again. It seems that he’s trying to strike a deal with an extremely discerning customer. As you might remember, Monsieur Mirkovic usually rewards those who help him.
makingDealsCrown.node.44: "However, I cannot imagine a good french woman such as yourself saying such a blasphemous thing in jest..." He continues, tapping his finger on his chin. "Perhaps, Monsieur Mirkovic, it would be prudent for me to make a provisional purchase, just in case."
makingDealsCrown.node.42: "It seems that we should discuss business after all."
makingDealsCrown.node.41: "Perhaps my spirits will provide your finer vintages with a necessary contrast? They could help highlight what makes French wine so unique."
makingDealsCrown.node.40: You quickly tuck the paper into your bodice, and move on before someone notices it. That little exchange has been profitable to you both.
makingDealsCrown.node.39: (You have gained a piece of Outrageous Crown Gossip)
makingDealsCrown.node.38: (You have gained a piece of Shocking Crown Gossip)
makingDealsCrown.node.37: (You have gained a piece of Cheap Crown Gossip)
makingDealsCrown.node.36: They step away, and you take a moment to examine the note that was slipped into your hand. It appears to concern some scurrilous things that Jakov overheard while speaking with some clients.
makingDealsCrown.node.35: "Ah, yes indeed!" The client-to-be replies, as sweet and cordial as the spirits he is likely to buy.
makingDealsCrown.node.34:
With this embarrassing display complete, you find yourself alone and with nothing to show for it.

Curses.
makingDealsCrown.node.33: Jakov leaves in hot pursuit, abandoning all attempts at dignity. "Monsieur, please reconsider!"
makingDealsCrown.node.32: The sneering patriot leaves in a huff, moving with the swagger of a man who's had his worst prejudices verified.
makingDealsCrown.node.31: Still facing the connoisseur, Jakov steps close to you, and slyly palms a note into your hand. "Monsieur, perhaps you and I should take this discussion elsewhere. After all, it's unseemly to discuss the specifics of finance in public."
makingDealsCrown.node.29: "Well, madame." He says, turning to you. "Your confidence in this foreigner appears to have been well placed. Very shrewd... very shrewd, indeed."
makingDealsCrown.node.28: (You have lost a decent amount of credibility)
makingDealsCrown.node.27: "Well, madame." He says, turning to you. "Your confidence in this foreigner appears to have been gravely misplaced."
makingDealsCrown.node.26: His face slowly sours. "It's as I suspected. This rakija, as you call it, is too sweet and sharp. It simply cannot match the complexity and subtlety of a French vintage."
makingDealsCrown.node.25: Slowly, his face turns to a mixture of happiness and surprise. "It's bold, but far more refined than I expected. A sweet taste of plums... it would certainly make a worthy pairing with dessert."
makingDealsCrown.node.24: He carefully sips the spirit, slowly swirling the drink around in his mouth...
makingDealsCrown.node.23: He carefully sips the spirit, slowly swirling the drink around in his mouth...
makingDealsCrown.node.22: The connoisseur takes the glass, carefully examines its color, sniffs it then gives a small toast. "Bonne chance, Monsieur Mirkovic
makingDealsCrown.node.21: "I have samples of my product, of course, but I'd rather not trust this entire sale to the whims of one man's palate." He sighs.
makingDealsCrown.node.20:
'Provisions'? Really? 

He's buying supplies for a party, not a grand expedition across the Alps.
makingDealsCrown.node.18: Jakov glances to you, adopting a worried smile. With a shrug, he reaches into his coat and uncorks a small sample bottle, pouring a clear liquor into a fresh glass obtained from the tray of a passing servant. "For your consideration, monsieur."
makingDealsCrown.node.17: "I would rather not sully my stores with inferior product in the name of novelty. Fashions may come and go, but quality is eternal. I have no need for such trivial frippery."
makingDealsCrown.node.16: "I suppose that does make a certain amount of sense. Not all of my guests share my refined tastes, and they may enjoy that certain novelty that Monsieur Mirkovic's wares are able to provide."
makingDealsCrown.node.15: "But, of course!" The connoiseur replies. "My refined palatte will be more than ready to see if this product is worthwhile."
makingDealsCrown.node.14: "Baltic wines, being better than French? Madame, have you taken leave of your senses, to utter such blasphemy?" He asks, utterly taken aback.
makingDealsCrown.node.12: "Though I can't imagine why I wouldn't just buy from a local merchant..."
makingDealsCrown.node.11: Before you can answer, the man in question has approached Jakov. This connoisseur carries himself with that humorless bearing that aflicts all men who are desperate to be taken seriously, even when they have nothing important to say. "Monsieur Mirkovic, I've been told that you're looking to speak with me about your foreign provisions."
makingDealsCrown.node.10: "If possible, I need your assistance making a sale here. I wouldn't normally need help with this aspect of the business, but this particular customer-to-be is quite... patriotic in his dealings. Put simply, he's skeptical of foreign merchants of any stripe, and it would help to have someone who is actually French speaking on my behalf."
makingDealsCrown.node.7: You consider petting Dušo, but notice that the cat's claws are extended, so you decide against it. Jakov merely shrugs and chuckles. "I suppose that's wise."
makingDealsCrown.node.6: You pet the cat and scratch her a little underneath his chin. She purrs appreciatively, but a few moments later she takes a playful swipe at your hands with her claws. Thankfully, you manage to pull back in time before she can scratch you. Jakov only laughs. "Would you believe that means she likes you?"
makingDealsCrown.node.5: "Look at this place..." Jakov continues, gesturing to everyone in sight. "I've never seen so much precious wine and spirits consumed in a single sitting. It's enough to make me nostalgic for home."
makingDealsCrown.node.4: As you step next to Jakov, Dušo starts to crane her head out towards you.
makingDealsCrown.node.3:
He recognizes you and narrows his eyes as you approach him. "Ah, you again."

Apparently, he has not forgotten the fact that you refused to help him on the docks, during his 'importing' operation.
makingDealsCrown.node.2: He recognizes you, and brightens up into a smile as you approach him. "Bonjour, Madame Decaux!" Apparently, he has not forgotten the times you've helped him with his 'importing' operation.
makingDealsCrown.node.1: You spot the liquor importer, Jakov Mirkovic again. He is, as always, accompanied by his cat, Dušo.
makingDealsCrown.node.0: You find yourself drawn to an open window and the precious breeze that it provides. This summer has been appallingly hot, and today is no different than any other.
makingDealsCrown.link.13: "Why not try one of his samples and just make the decision yourself, monsieur?"
makingDealsCrown.link.12: "You'd buy from him because even his wines are better than some French vintages."
makingDealsCrown.link.11: "Isn't there a value in having a variety of spirits available for your guests?"

spilledDrinksCrown.name: Spilled Drinks
spilledDrinksCrown.description: It appears that some guest has spilled their drink on you. Surely, an apology is in order for such a glaring misstep, non?
spilledDrinksCrown.node.22: This feels right. You could get used to this.
spilledDrinksCrown.node.20: Eyes frowning, mouths agape, the pair just stares at you in shock.
spilledDrinksCrown.node.19:
(You have gained a decent amount of credibility)
(You have gained some peril)
spilledDrinksCrown.node.17: Eyes frowning, mouths agape, the pair just stares at you in shock.
spilledDrinksCrown.node.16: "What are you, a child?" The inebriated friend manages to ask. You can hear a few chuckles from the crowd around you.
spilledDrinksCrown.node.14: The room feels palpably quieter as the two of them stare at you in disbelief.
spilledDrinksCrown.node.13:
Her drunk friend decides that now would be a good time to chime in. "What's wrong? It's not like I made that dress look any worse."

You hear a few people in the crowd chuckle at this clumsy barb.
spilledDrinksCrown.node.12: With a mutter of apology, the pair depart and leave you alone. The crowd takes their focus off of you and returns to the party.
spilledDrinksCrown.node.11:
With narry a backward glance, the two leave, giggling to themselves.

Looking around at the rest of the guests at the party, hoping to find some sort of aid, you can tell that you're being studiously ignored.
spilledDrinksCrown.node.10: With a mutter of half hearted retorts, the pair skulk away, much to the delight of those present. Your dress may be in worse condition than when you started, but at least you got to have some fun at the expense of those who deserve it.
spilledDrinksCrown.node.9: "Ah yes, we'll certainly apologize for you being so careless as to spill wine all over yourself at the slightest nudge."
spilledDrinksCrown.node.8: Not only are the pair in front of you somewhat taken aback by your firm request, the watching crowd mutters in approval. While the two women don't seem thrilled about having to apologize, they can tell that the room has turned against them in a serious way.
spilledDrinksCrown.node.7: Before they can even say anything, they're interrupted with laughter from the other guests in this room, who seem to appreciate your biting wit. The pair of women settle on staring daggers in your direction until the laughter subsides.
spilledDrinksCrown.node.6: They stare at you, wordlessly for a moment. It's as if they're bewildered by your simple request.
spilledDrinksCrown.node.5: Surprised by your patience and mangnanimity, they get some water and help you blot at the stain before it dries completely. It's enough to get rid of most of the stain, but it's still noticeable to those who look for it.
spilledDrinksCrown.node.4: "Why did we stop? Where are we going?" She slurs, looking confused.
spilledDrinksCrown.node.3: Turning around, you see two women, one of them is obviously deep in their cups. The other appears to be trying to prevent her friend from embarrassing themselves too much. "Sorry about the stain, we were just leaving." The sober one apologizes half-heartedly.
spilledDrinksCrown.node.2: Looking down, you see an enormous wine stain down your front.
spilledDrinksCrown.node.1: Suddenly, you feel someone barge into you, sending you reeling a few steps. While you manage to catch your balance on a nearby table, your chest feels wet, and your wineglass now appears to be empty. Oh no.
spilledDrinksCrown.node.0: Relaxing at the party, you feel more comfortable with your new life than before. Sipping from your recently acquired glass of wine, you notice a fresh batch of hors d'oeuvres being brought out from the kitchen.
spilledDrinksCrown.link.9: "That's a good question. Why did you stop? Embarrassments like you belong outside."
spilledDrinksCrown.link.2: "It's alright, you're free to go when I get an apology."
spilledDrinksCrown.link.1: "Pardon, I'm not mad, can you just help me blot this stain before it sets?"

spilledDrinksChurch.node.9: "Ah yes, we'll certainly apologize for you being so careless as to spill wine all over yourself at the slightest nudge."
spilledDrinksChurch.node.8: Not only are the pair in front of you somewhat taken aback by your firm request, the watching crowd mutters in approval. While the two women don't seem thrilled about having to apologize, they can tell that the room has turned against them in a serious way.
spilledDrinksChurch.node.7: Before they can even say anything, they're interrupted with laughter from the other guests in this room, who seem to appreciate your biting wit. The pair of women settle on staring daggers in your direction until the laughter subsides.
spilledDrinksChurch.node.6: They stare at you, wordlessly for a moment. It's as if they're bewildered by your simple request.
spilledDrinksChurch.node.5: Surprised by your patience and mangnanimity, they get some water and help you blot at the stain before it dries completely. It's enough to get rid of most of the stain, but it's still noticeable to those who look for it.
spilledDrinksChurch.node.4: "Why did we stop? Where are we going?" She slurs, looking confused.
spilledDrinksChurch.node.3: Turning around, you see two women, one of them is obviously deep in their cups. The other appears to be trying to prevent her friend from embarrassing themselves too much. "Sorry about the stain, we were just leaving." The sober one apologizes half-heartedly.
spilledDrinksChurch.node.2: Looking down, you see an enormous wine stain down your front.
spilledDrinksChurch.node.1: Suddenly, you feel someone barge into you, sending you reeling a few steps. While you manage to catch your balance on a nearby table, your chest feels wet, and your wineglass now appears to be empty. Oh no.
spilledDrinksChurch.node.0: Relaxing at the party, you feel more comfortable with your new life than before. Sipping from your recently acquired glass of wine, you notice a fresh batch of hors d'oeuvres being brought out from the kitchen.
spilledDrinksChurch.link.9: "That's a good question. Why did you stop? Embarrassments like you belong outside."
spilledDrinksChurch.link.2: "It's alright, you're free to go when I get an apology."
spilledDrinksChurch.link.1: "Pardon, I'm not mad, can you just help me blot this stain before it sets?"

feignedAcquaintanceCrown.name: Feigned Acquaintance
feignedAcquaintanceCrown.description: Someone is absolutely bursting at the seams with the desire to discuss something concerning the host, but only with those who know the host well. You might not, but when has such a triviality ever stopped you?
feignedAcquaintanceCrown.node.17: "By the way, have you heard about our host's..." She trails off, but looks clearly excited.
feignedAcquaintanceCrown.node.16:
After a few awkward pauses, you both see that this conversation has ceased to go anywhere pleasant. With that, the two of you silently drift apart. 

How disappointing
feignedAcquaintanceCrown.node.15: Perhaps there something else you can do, while you're here.
feignedAcquaintanceCrown.node.14: With the information extracted, you manage to find a way to gracefully exit the conversation. You're not sure why, but you're reasonably certain that you heard her give a sigh of relief as you walk away.
feignedAcquaintanceCrown.node.13: Now that she's been thrown off balance by your claim to know the host even better than she does, you manage to continue the conversation, using context cues to pull the details of this story from her. These details are of some interest, indeed.
feignedAcquaintanceCrown.node.12: (You have gained a piece of Cheap Crown Gossip)
feignedAcquaintanceCrown.node.11: "I find that suspiciously broad claim rather hard to believe." She replies, leveling an accusing glare at you.
feignedAcquaintanceCrown.node.10: Now that her defenses are down, you manage to continue the conversation, using context cues to pull the details of this story from her. These details are of some interest, indeed.
feignedAcquaintanceCrown.node.9:
(You have lost some credibility)
(You have gained a little peril)
feignedAcquaintanceCrown.node.8: "Magnifique! I've been dying to discuss this all day. Simply scandalous, is it not?"
feignedAcquaintanceCrown.node.6: "We've barely begun to talk, and you already shy away, as if you've been bitten? That's certainly no fun."
feignedAcquaintanceCrown.node.4: You may have her fooled now, but that claim feels like the sort of thing that will definitely come back to haunt you.
feignedAcquaintanceCrown.node.3: "Oh! I had no idea the two of you were so well acquainted! My apologies."
feignedAcquaintanceCrown.node.2: "Oh, you've already heard, then?" She asks, while you try to maintain a straight face.
feignedAcquaintanceCrown.node.1: "I guess the question I should be asking is: how well do you know them?"
feignedAcquaintanceCrown.node.0: While taking a turn through the party, you find yourself talking with a woman about the host. You don't know the host particularly well, but she seems decently acquainted with them.
feignedAcquaintanceCrown.link.5: "I know our host better that you might think. Now, what exactly did you hear?"
feignedAcquaintanceCrown.link.3: "I don't know them, but this already feels like something I shouldn't be discussing."
feignedAcquaintanceCrown.link.0: "I already know the issue you're thinking of. Of course, I'd love to hear your perspective."

feignedAcquaintanceRevolution.link.5: "I know our host better that you might think. Now, what exactly did you hear?"
feignedAcquaintanceRevolution.link.3: "I don't know them, but this already feels like something I shouldn't be discussing."
feignedAcquaintanceRevolution.link.0: "I already know the issue you're thinking of. Of course, I'd love to hear your perspective."
aSmallWagerCrown.name: A Small Wager
aSmallWagerCrown.description: Games of chance might be illegal, but that doesn’t mean they aren’t widely enjoyed. After all, if the chance to win or lose great fortunes wasn’t dangerously thrilling, they’d never need to make a law prohibiting it.

aSmallWagerBourgeoisie.name: A Small Wager
aSmallWagerBourgeoisie.description: Games of chance might be illegal, but that doesn’t mean they aren’t widely enjoyed. After all, if the chance to win or lose great fortunes wasn’t dangerously thrilling, they’d never need to make a law prohibiting it.

aSmallWagerRevolution.link.45: "It does sound like fun. I'm sure a single round wouldn't hurt..."
aSmallWagerRevolution.link.44: "I'm sorry, but this doesn't feel like a good idea."
aSmallWagerRevolution.link.40: "Well, when you put it that way, I'm sure a single round wouldn't hurt."
aSmallWagerRevolution.link.7: "Let's make this exciting, shall we? Fifty Livres."
aSmallWagerRevolution.link.5: "Ten Livres seems like a good place to start."

aSmallWagerRevolution.link.1: "Risk a little coin, gain a little excitement? Sounds fun!"
aBriefSkulkCrown.name: A Brief Skulk
aBriefSkulkCrown.description: It appears that the party’s host has left their study unlocked… this might be a valuable opportunity, for someone of a more unscrupulous nature.
aBriefSkulkCrown.node.43: Slowly and quietly, the maid backs away without any further investigation. Soon, you return to mingling with the other guests amidst the party proper.
aBriefSkulkCrown.node.42: Slowly and quietly, the maid backs away without any further investigation. Soon, you return to mingling with the other guests amidst the party proper.
aBriefSkulkCrown.node.41: Committing the details to memory, you survey the room and realize that you've already taken everything of value to you. Without any other matters to attend to here, you leave.
aBriefSkulkCrown.node.40: (You have gained a piece of Cheap Revolution Gossip)
aBriefSkulkCrown.node.39: (You have gained a piece of Cheap Bourgeoisie Gossip)
aBriefSkulkCrown.node.38: (You have gained a piece of Cheap Military Gossip)
aBriefSkulkCrown.node.37: (You have gained a piece of Cheap Church Gossip)
aBriefSkulkCrown.node.36: (You have gained a piece of Cheap Crown Gossip)
aBriefSkulkCrown.node.35: Your eyes settle on a half-finished letter to one of the host's confidants. Amidst the usual pleasantries, you read something quite useful.
aBriefSkulkCrown.node.34: You quickly sift through the papers on the desk, looking for anything that might provide you with a valuable rumor that you could sell to Pierre.
aBriefSkulkCrown.node.33: (You have gained a decent amount of peril)
aBriefSkulkCrown.node.32: You carefully secret the gem under your stays. Looking over the room, it seems that you've already taken everything of value to you. Without any other matters to attend to here, you leave.
aBriefSkulkCrown.node.30: Your efforts pay off when you manage to find a single ruby, probably intended to be set into some jewelry later.
aBriefSkulkCrown.node.29: You rifle through the drawers of the desk, searching for any loose coins, precious stones or other valuables you could take with you. Your host clearly has more than enough money. They'll never miss this.
aBriefSkulkCrown.node.28: (You have gained a decent amount of peril)
aBriefSkulkCrown.node.27: Instead of staying to come up with some outrageous excuse for something they never actually saw you do, you simply leave her behind. Soon, you're back among the party proper.
aBriefSkulkCrown.node.26: She is about to say something to you, but all it takes is a single withering glare from Thérèse to make her reconsider this course of action.
aBriefSkulkCrown.node.25: She is about to say something to you, but all it takes is a single withering glare from Hansel to make her reconsider this course of action.
aBriefSkulkCrown.node.23: Just as you finish closing the door behind you, one of the chambermaids rounds the corner and eyes you suspiciously.
aBriefSkulkCrown.node.22: Continuing to pilfer the room of its contents, you remain keenly aware of how risky your efforts are at the moment.

aBriefSkulkCrown.link.31: "Now would be a good time to leave."
aBriefSkulkCrown.link.30: "Now would be a good time to leave."
aBriefSkulkCrown.link.29: "I'm already here, so maybe the papers on that desk can lead me to valuable gossip."
aBriefSkulkCrown.link.24: "I'm already here, so I should look for any unattended valuables."
aBriefSkulkCrown.link.7: "I should look for some unattended valuables."
aBriefSkulkCrown.link.2: "Non, I'm not doing something like this."
aBriefSkulkCrown.link.1: "The papers on that desk might lead to some valuable gossip."

distantDaysChurch.name: Distant Days
distantDaysChurch.description: You recall a far off memory. It’s of the time when you and Armand first met.
distantDaysChurch.node.49: With a great effort, you both manage to divert the conversation to funny stories from your pasts. It feels like exactly what it is, a pleasant diversion. Something better than dwelling on anger.
distantDaysChurch.node.48: "I thought myself enraged, but it seems I was a mere pretender to the throne." He laughs, as a cold wind causes you to shiver.
distantDaysChurch.node.47: With that, you return to the party.
distantDaysChurch.node.46: While you manage to return your thoughts to the here and now, you cannot manage to completely discard the memory. You find yourself examining its various details long after, as you distantly puzzle upon its significance.
distantDaysChurch.node.45: With a dismissive snort, you clear your head and return to the here and now. Dwelling on the past is for fools with neither actions for their present, nor ambitions for their future.
distantDaysChurch.node.44: While you manage to return your thoughts to the here and now, you cannot manage to completely discard the memory. The pull of fanciful reminiscence is as strong as it is sweet.
distantDaysChurch.node.43: (You have gained a little favor with Armand)
distantDaysChurch.node.42: He would, of course, learn your name later. Still, it was fun to make him put in some effort for it.
distantDaysChurch.node.41: Like all memories, it begins to dissolve once the most important elements pass.
distantDaysChurch.node.40: With that, Armand leaves. The breeze blows and you feel a brief shiver, so you wrap his coat about your shoulders. The collar smells like him, mixed with a trace of perfume.
distantDaysChurch.node.39: "Should you feel the need to return it, I like to spend my Sundays reading at Le Cygne." He says, gesturing in the direction of the tavern.
distantDaysChurch.node.38: (You have gained some favor with Armand)
distantDaysChurch.node.37: "Unfortunately, I must go, or my presence will be missed. However, before I go, please take this. It's frightfully cold out here." He says, taking off his coat and handing it to you. His breath steams in the air, and the coat is still warm with his body heat.
distantDaysChurch.node.36: (You have gained a little favor with Armand)
distantDaysChurch.node.35: He smiles. "I can understand that. Fury can be gratifying, but it rarely makes anything better."
distantDaysChurch.node.34: "However, before I go, please take this. It's frightfully cold out here." He says, taking off his coat and handing it to you. His breath steams in the air, and the coat is still warm with his body heat.
distantDaysChurch.node.33: "Say no more, madame." He says, giving you a theatrical bow. "I shall leave you to your brooding, and will attend to my own, elsewhere."
distantDaysChurch.node.32: Before you realize it, you find yourself unrolling a list of every enmity you have in the town, punctuated by every one of their mental failings. It's a long list.
distantDaysChurch.node.31: "Now, you've heard of my woes, but what troubles you tonight?"
distantDaysChurch.node.30: He takes your hand and gently kisses the back of it. Normally such an overly familiar gesture would disgust you, but he does it with light, practiced grace. Like it was the most normal thing in the world.
distantDaysChurch.node.29: The two of you stare into each other's eyes and as your gaze plays along his moonlit features, you wonder how you've both managed to go so long without meeting.
distantDaysChurch.node.28: "Which sounds nice, until one realizes that my attendance is also expected as a matter of course."
distantDaysChurch.node.27: He sits down next to you and sighs, staring out into the darkness alongside you. With a rueful smile, he shakes his head, tousling his long hair back and forth.
distantDaysChurch.node.26: He stops, and examines you quietly as you fume in the garden. "It's a... it's a familiar feeling for you too, isn't it?"
distantDaysChurch.node.25: "No matter what I say, it's always the same. Everyone just nods, agrees, then changes the conversation to whatever suits them better. I might as well not even be there."
distantDaysChurch.node.24: "For the love of God, they're just cows! I'm sure they chew cud like virtuosos, but after four months, I'm about to push the damn things into the lake!"
distantDaysChurch.node.23: "It's just agonizingly boring! Everyone wants to talk about the same things, over and over again! Marie is suspicious of the new priest, Jaques wants to complain about the drainage in his lower field, and Guillaume will find any excuse to boast about his new cows."
distantDaysChurch.node.22: "Ah yes. In all honestly, I'm invited to everything in town as a matter of course."
distantDaysChurch.node.21: "A mysterious woman brooding alone in the garden, infuriated by very things that try my patience as well? You're the first pleasant surprise I've encountered in days."
distantDaysChurch.node.20: "It's a pleasure to meet you, Yvette."
distantDaysChurch.node.18: Armand never mentioned his last name to you, or even that he was a baron, until the third time you met. He pretended that it was because he thought it was unimportant, but you knew better. He was sick of the deference and groveling that came with his position.
distantDaysChurch.node.16: "Oh! My apologies, I never introduced myself."
distantDaysChurch.node.15: "My apologies, fair brooding woman. When I said I didn't expect anyone here, that wasn't an idle jest. I love our town here, and its people, but that doesn't mean that they can't try my patience sometimes."
distantDaysChurch.node.14: Instead, he listens to you, and laughs.
distantDaysChurch.node.13: "Ah, I'm so sorry, I didn't realize this spot was taken!"
distantDaysChurch.node.12: "Everything here just feels like it's going around in a circle, like a waterwheel. The waters of the river rush onwards to new things, but the wheel merely spins."
distantDaysChurch.node.11: (You have gained some favor with this handsome stranger)
distantDaysChurch.node.10: (You have gained some favor with this handsome stranger)
distantDaysChurch.node.9: (You have gained some favor with this handsome stranger)
distantDaysChurch.node.8: His back stiffens ever-so-slightly at this question. "Well, I don't want to be the source of turmoil, as it would reflect poorly on my family..."
distantDaysChurch.node.7: He laughs "Well, if you insist madame. Let it never be said that I refused the calls of a charming woman, especially when she's a piqued as I am."
distantDaysChurch.node.6: You didn't know him, but you knew this routine well enough. This was normally the part where they called you a frigid woman and either stayed to insult you further, or merely stormed away.
distantDaysChurch.node.5: "I was planning on fuming, alone in the garden, but an occupier has already laid their claim."
distantDaysChurch.node.4: In fact, you were at just such a party, bored to the verge of tears and making conversation with yourself, when you heard someone walking up behind you.
distantDaysChurch.node.3: Of course, when you last felt like this, the parties were much smaller. They were also much less elegant, and they felt even less exciting than the one you're attending right now.
distantDaysChurch.node.2: If nothing else, this feeling is certainly familiar.
distantDaysChurch.node.1: Thankfully, you manage to find a deserted corner, so you can just focus on yourself. While you're adjusting your stays so that they sit more comfortably, you consider your poor luck. It's not you, it's just that nobody has anything exciting to say right now.
distantDaysChurch.node.0: You wander around the party for a while, trying to find a conversation that feels right, but only end up feeling lost. Rather than wasting time on something that isn't working, you decide to take some time to yourself. It's been difficult to focus all day, and you're not certain as to why.
distantDaysChurch.link.49: "Of all the things to remember, why does this strike me now?"
distantDaysChurch.link.48: "Ugh, I was foolish to fall for such empty advances."
distantDaysChurch.link.47: "Ah, such a pleasant memory from simpler times."
distantDaysChurch.link.36: "Pardonnez-moi, but I would prefer to be alone, for the moment."
distantDaysChurch.link.35: "If it's alright, I'd rather talk about something pleasant."
distantDaysChurch.link.34: "What doesn't trouble me? This whole place is going nowhere, and it's infuriating."
distantDaysChurch.link.6: "What's troubling you so much? Aren't parties supposed to be fun?"
distantDaysChurch.link.5: "Don't waste your time dissembling. Just join me already."
distantDaysChurch.link.4: "Correct. Now begone, as this garden is mine by right of conquest."
distantDaysCrown.name: Distant Days
distantDaysCrown.description: You recall a far off memory. It’s of the time when you and Armand first met.
distantDaysCrown.node.49: With a great effort, you both manage to divert the conversation to funny stories from your pasts. It feels like exactly what it is, a pleasant diversion. Something better than dwelling on anger.
distantDaysCrown.node.48: "I thought myself enraged, but it seems I was a mere pretender to the throne." He laughs, as a cold wind causes you to shiver.
distantDaysCrown.node.47: With that, you return to the party.
distantDaysCrown.node.46: While you manage to return your thoughts to the here and now, you cannot manage to completely discard the memory. You find yourself examining its various details long after, as you distantly puzzle upon its significance.
distantDaysCrown.node.45: With a dismissive snort, you clear your head and return to the here and now. Dwelling on the past is for fools with neither actions for their present, nor ambitions for their future.
distantDaysCrown.node.44: While you manage to return your thoughts to the here and now, you cannot manage to completely discard the memory. The pull of fanciful reminiscence is as strong as it is sweet.
distantDaysCrown.node.43: (You have gained a little favor with Armand)
distantDaysCrown.node.42: He would, of course, learn your name later. Still, it was fun to make him put in some effort for it.
distantDaysCrown.node.41: Like all memories, it begins to dissolve once the most important elements pass.
distantDaysCrown.node.40: With that, Armand leaves. The breeze blows and you feel a brief shiver, so you wrap his coat about your shoulders. The collar smells like him, mixed with a trace of perfume.
distantDaysCrown.node.39: "Should you feel the need to return it, I like to spend my Sundays reading at Le Cygne." He says, gesturing in the direction of the tavern.
distantDaysCrown.node.38: (You have gained some favor with Armand)
distantDaysCrown.node.37: "Unfortunately, I must go, or my presence will be missed. However, before I go, please take this. It's frightfully cold out here." He says, taking off his coat and handing it to you. His breath steams in the air, and the coat is still warm with his body heat.

distantDaysRevolution.name: Distant Days
distantDaysRevolution.description: You recall a far off memory. It’s of the time when you and Armand first met.
distantDaysRevolution.node.49: With a great effort, you both manage to divert the conversation to funny stories from your pasts. It feels like exactly what it is, a pleasant diversion. Something better than dwelling on anger.
distantDaysRevolution.node.48: "I thought myself enraged, but it seems I was a mere pretender to the throne." He laughs, as a cold wind causes you to shiver.
distantDaysRevolution.node.47: With that, you return to the party.
distantDaysRevolution.node.46: While you manage to return your thoughts to the here and now, you cannot manage to completely discard the memory. You find yourself examining its various details long after, as you distantly puzzle upon its significance.
distantDaysRevolution.node.45: With a dismissive snort, you clear your head and return to the here and now. Dwelling on the past is for fools with neither actions for their present, nor ambitions for their future.
distantDaysRevolution.node.44: While you manage to return your thoughts to the here and now, you cannot manage to completely discard the memory. The pull of fanciful reminiscence is as strong as it is sweet.
distantDaysRevolution.node.43: (You have gained a little favor with Armand)
distantDaysRevolution.node.42: He would, of course, learn your name later. Still, it was fun to make him put in some effort for it.
distantDaysRevolution.node.41: Like all memories, it begins to dissolve once the most important elements pass.
distantDaysRevolution.node.40: With that, Armand leaves. The breeze blows and you feel a brief shiver, so you wrap his coat about your shoulders. The collar smells like him, mixed with a trace of perfume.
distantDaysRevolution.node.39: "Should you feel the need to return it, I like to spend my Sundays reading at Le Cygne." He says, gesturing in the direction of the tavern.
distantDaysRevolution.node.38: (You have gained some favor with Armand)
distantDaysRevolution.node.37: "Unfortunately, I must go, or my presence will be missed. However, before I go, please take this. It's frightfully cold out here." He says, taking off his coat and handing it to you. His breath steams in the air, and the coat is still warm with his body heat.
distantDaysRevolution.node.36: (You have gained a little favor with Armand)
distantDaysRevolution.node.35: He smiles. "I can understand that. Fury can be gratifying, but it rarely makes anything better."
distantDaysRevolution.node.34: "However, before I go, please take this. It's frightfully cold out here." He says, taking off his coat and handing it to you. His breath steams in the air, and the coat is still warm with his body heat.
distantDaysRevolution.node.33: "Say no more, madame." He says, giving you a theatrical bow. "I shall leave you to your brooding, and will attend to my own, elsewhere."
distantDaysRevolution.node.32: Before you realize it, you find yourself unrolling a list of every enmity you have in the town, punctuated by every one of their mental failings. It's a long list.
distantDaysRevolution.node.31: "Now, you've heard of my woes, but what troubles you tonight?"
distantDaysRevolution.node.30: He takes your hand and gently kisses the back of it. Normally such an overly familiar gesture would disgust you, but he does it with light, practiced grace. Like it was the most normal thing in the world.
distantDaysRevolution.node.29: The two of you stare into each other's eyes and as your gaze plays along his moonlit features, you wonder how you've both managed to go so long without meeting.
distantDaysRevolution.node.28: "Which sounds nice, until one realizes that my attendance is also expected as a matter of course."
distantDaysRevolution.node.27: He sits down next to you and sighs, staring out into the darkness alongside you. With a rueful smile, he shakes his head, tousling his long hair back and forth.
distantDaysRevolution.node.26: He stops, and examines you quietly as you fume in the garden. "It's a... it's a familiar feeling for you too, isn't it?"
distantDaysRevolution.node.25: "No matter what I say, it's always the same. Everyone just nods, agrees, then changes the conversation to whatever suits them better. I might as well not even be there."
distantDaysRevolution.node.24: "For the love of God, they're just cows! I'm sure they chew cud like virtuosos, but after four months, I'm about to push the damn things into the lake!"
distantDaysRevolution.node.23: "It's just agonizingly boring! Everyone wants to talk about the same things, over and over again! Marie is suspicious of the new priest, Jaques wants to complain about the drainage in his lower field, and Guillaume will find any excuse to boast about his new cows."
distantDaysRevolution.node.22: "Ah yes. In all honestly, I'm invited to everything in town as a matter of course."
distantDaysRevolution.node.21: "A mysterious woman brooding alone in the garden, infuriated by very things that try my patience as well? You're the first pleasant surprise I've encountered in days."
distantDaysRevolution.node.20: "It's a pleasure to meet you, Yvette."
distantDaysRevolution.node.18: Armand never mentioned his last name to you, or even that he was a baron, until the third time you met. He pretended that it was because he thought it was unimportant, but you knew better. He was sick of the deference and groveling that came with his position.
distantDaysRevolution.node.16: "Oh! My apologies, I never introduced myself."
distantDaysRevolution.node.15: "My apologies, fair brooding woman. When I said I didn't expect anyone here, that wasn't an idle jest. I love our town here, and its people, but that doesn't mean that they can't try my patience sometimes."
distantDaysRevolution.node.14: Instead, he listens to you, and laughs.
distantDaysRevolution.node.13: "Ah, I'm so sorry, I didn't realize this spot was taken!"

Honorade stares at the guinguette and swallows deeply, her face slightly paler than usual. "Oh... there is... a lot of wine here."

Her voice is apprehensive.
Turning her attention from you, she surveys your location.
"Oh, this is very pleasing." She says, looking at you through narrowed eyes as she slowly circles you like a panther. "You've done quite well."
Ever since you arrived together, Madame Gazel has been standing far closer than the rules of politeness might allow. It's easy to forget how good she is at looming over people.
You return to the idyllic Guinguette Paradis, which is already packed with enthusiastic patrons, clapping in time with the band's music, drinking great gulps of wine, and dancing.
After spending the first half of the day getting ready, you head out for your rendezvous.

Ever since you arrived together, Madame Gazel has been standing far closer than the rules of politeness might allow. It's easy to forget how good she is at looming over people.

You return to Les Grands-Danseurs du Roi and the energy is already frantic. While the stage performers are still getting ready, various jugglers, comedians and animal handlers are working the aisles, building the energy of the audience.
After spending the first half of the day getting ready, you head out for your rendezvous.
commissioningVengeance.name: Commissioning Vengeance
commissioningVengeance.description: The next step of your plan to wreak vengeance upon Baron Maximin de Termes requires you to commission a painting from one Élisabeth Le Brun.
commissioningVengeance.node.34: "Of course, you're more than a mere client, so I still haven't broken that rule..."
commissioningVengeance.node.33: You arrive at her studio, and notice that the door has been left ajar, which is certainly odd. After a minute of waiting to see if anyone is around, you simply let yourself in.
commissioningVengeance.node.32: None of the stories about people seeking revenge truly prepared you for how socially awkward some of this business is.
commissioningVengeance.node.31: You're planning on showing up unannounced, at the studio of a great painter you've never met, all for the sake of vengeance.
commissioningVengeance.node.30: While you know Élisabeth, you've never actually been to her studio before. Hopefully, this isn't overstepping any boundaries too much.
commissioningVengeance.node.29: Thankfully, you've already visited her before, so it's quite easy for you to find.
commissioningVengeance.node.28: “Sorry, I got carried away there. I will absolutely paint this, if it means that I get to put that pretentious blowhard in his place. How do you want me to do this?”
commissioningVengeance.node.26: “It’s a self portrait! People have been painting them for… forever! It’s a classic display of an artist’s skills!” She shakes her head angrily. “Honestly, why is it that when men paint pictures of themselves they’re ‘engaging in a serious study’, but when I paint one, it’s suddenly all about my vanity?”
commissioningVengeance.node.25: “Sorry, I just hate that man. Did you know that he called one of my self portraits ‘uninspired and selfish’?”
commissioningVengeance.node.22: With that, you depart, but your vengeance approaches.
commissioningVengeance.node.21: You spend a few minutes telling Élisabeth about where to find Marguerite Bonnet, and what exactly the painting needs to display. You don’t know how you’ll use this painting yet, but it still means that you’re a step closer than you were before.
commissioningVengeance.node.20: “Sorry, I got carried away there. I will absolutely paint this. Where can I find my subjects, and what, exactly, does this painting need to convey to the viewer?”
commissioningVengeance.node.19: “A painting that actually solves a problem in someone’s life? Oh, this will be some of my best work...”
commissioningVengeance.node.18: “This, on the other hand. This is exactly what I’ve been looking for!”
commissioningVengeance.node.17: “A more beautiful one? Definitely. A better one? I’m not sure.” Her sketching starts to speed up.
commissioningVengeance.node.16: “Lots of people like my paintings, even important people like the Queen. Still, I’m always wondering if I’m actually making the world a better place.”
commissioningVengeance.node.15: She starts sketching a little. “Every artist faces the same problem. You spend your whole life making beautiful things, but you’re never sure that anything you’re doing actually matters.”
commissioningVengeance.node.13: “You mean actual, physical justice? From a painting?”
commissioningVengeance.node.12: "Oh, you’re actually serious." She realizes aloud.
commissioningVengeance.node.11: “I could work with that, but what’s going to make this interesting?”
commissioningVengeance.node.10: "What's this about? Are you looking to commission me?"
commissioningVengeance.node.9: Élisabeth tilts back her head and laughs at your proposal. After a while, she pauses to reexamine your expression.
commissioningVengeance.node.8: She rubs her chin thoughtfully, then picks up her sketchbook and starts to flip through it, examining old ideas. “A mother with son?”
commissioningVengeance.node.7: “Even though you’d make a very intriguing subject.”
commissioningVengeance.node.6: "Nothing, I guess." She replies, slowly calming down. "Just preparing another canvas for when I get some new work."
commissioningVengeance.node.5: “A very special portrait?” she asks, calming quickly as her curiosity is obviously piqued. “I’ll warn you now, I don’t paint nudes of my clients.”
commissioningVengeance.node.4: She turns to you and nearly jumps out of her skin "Who the devil are you?"
commissioningVengeance.node.3: Inside, you find her sipping idly on some wine, while she prepares a canvas. The air is thick with the smell of canvas, gesso and paint. Not knowing how else to get her attention, you clear your throat.
commissioningVengeance.node.2: She turns to you and nearly jumps out of her skin "Yvette! What are you doing here?"
commissioningVengeance.node.1: Inside, you find her sipping idly on some wine, while she prepares a canvas. The air is thick with the smell of canvas, gesso and paint. Not knowing how else to get her attention, you clear your throat.
commissioningVengeance.node.0: You waste no time in heading out to go to Madame Le Brun's studio.
commissioningVengeance.link.44: "How does 'use the art of painting to destroy a wicked man' sound for a subject?"
commissioningVengeance.link.43: "In this case, I'm actually hoping you'll paint my friend and her son."
commissioningVengeance.link.17: “Absolutely. I want you to paint a painting that will destroy Baron Maximin de Termes.”
commissioningVengeance.link.16: “Yes, your painting could help my friend Marguerite get justice.”
commissioningVengeance.link.14: “The main goal of this painting is to destroy the wicked Baron Maximin de Termes.”
commissioningVengeance.link.13: “This painting is going to help my friend Marguerite get the justice she deserves.”
commissioningVengeance.link.11: "Specifically, I'm hoping you can help me use the art of painting to destroy a wicked man."
commissioningVengeance.link.10: “If you're interested, yes. A friend of mine and her young son."
commissioningVengeance.link.8: “How does ‘use the art of painting to destroy a wicked man’ sound, for intriguing?”
commissioningVengeance.link.7: “I’m flattered, but I’m actually hoping you’ll paint my friend and her son.”
commissioningVengeance.link.4: "Madame Le Brun, I'd like to commission you for a very special portrait."
commissioningVengeance.link.2: “Élisabeth, I’d like to commission you for a very special portrait.”
pierresInformation.name: Pierre's Information
pierresInformation.node.29: "The first is that they show an open disdain for the country's current laws and privileges, which made them unwelcome with the aristocracy supporting the Crown. However, they also harbor a strong devotion to the Queen, which alienated them to the nationalists in the Revolution."
pierresInformation.node.28: "Some mad arsonist burned the damned place to the ground!" He screams.
pierresInformation.node.26: "So, my apologies madame, but I'm sorry to report that you won't be able find much there. I hope you'll find this bonus to be a suitable compensation for this latest difficulty."
pierresInformation.node.25: ('The Abandoned Studio' is now available for you to visit on the Paris map)
pierresInformation.node.24: Pierre starts scribbling on a piece of paper. When he hands it off to you, you find it to be an address. "The Guet Royal raided the studio a month ago and arrested everyone there." Pierre explains.
pierresInformation.node.23: "I can't just print gossip thats been sold to everyone else. My readers expect something unique in these pages, not the same unoriginal tripe bandied about in those lesser papers." He continues, his outrage shockingly sincere.
pierresInformation.node.22: "I would tell you more about it but..."
pierresInformation.node.20: (You have reached the rank of 'Journalist' at Le Trompette du Peuple. The title itself is meaningless, but it certainly sounds nice.)
pierresInformation.node.19: "In fact, your contributions have been so great that they must be recognized. Madame Decaux, you are no longer a mere gossip monger..."
pierresInformation.node.18: At the mention of God, Pierre makes the sign of the cross, but you’re pretty sure he did it backwards. "Adieu, and may our paths cross again!"
pierresInformation.node.17: Pierre nods and grins, “But, of course, Madame! It is merely business, but I still hope it is good business. Adieu, madame!”
pierresInformation.node.16: Pierre puts down his snuff box and favors you with a deep and theatrical bow. "Now, you flatter me madame. Bonne chance, and may God see fit to reunite you with your Armand in great haste."
pierresInformation.node.15: “I like to think we’ve made good business partners, non?”
pierresInformation.node.14: “But please, enough about such ignoble matters, you are here to learn of your fiancé, non?”
pierresInformation.node.13: While the empty liquor bottles laying on the ground make you doubt his honesty a little, you get the feeling that he isn’t going to budge on this.
pierresInformation.node.12: He gestures to his dilapidated and stained office. “However, while the pursuit of truth may make a man virtuous, it does not make him wealthy. The coins I give are all I can spare, as I need all that remains to keep the wheels of my press turning.”
pierresInformation.node.11: Pierre scowls at you for a fraction of a second, before breaking out into a wide and almost-sympathetic grin. “Madame, but if only I could! I would pay for your gracious insights with bars of silver, and fistfuls of rubies, as that is what they are worth!”
pierresInformation.node.10: “Merci beaucoups, madame…” he sighs, pausing to snort a heavy pinch of snuff. “But please, enough about my troubles, you are here to learn of your fiancé, non?”
pierresInformation.node.9: “I need you because my other sources have taken their business to… less esteemed publications.”
pierresInformation.node.8: “Newspapers like my own have always existed in one… unofficial capacity or another, but with the end of royal censorship, new papers are opening every day! The competition for readership, and for new information, has become ridiculous!” Pierre throws up his hands in exasperation.
pierresInformation.node.7: "While supporting the Queen is certainly no crime, something about this group's beliefs was making someone in power quite uncomfortable. The studio's been abandoned ever since. Go there, and you might find something that leads you to your Armand.”
pierresInformation.node.6: "There’s a studio in the western part of the city, just south of the Seine, where he and some like minded individuals preferred to discuss the 'proper' course for the country. Painters in the front, planning in the back."
pierresInformation.node.5: “Now, before you leave madame, I hope that you do not forget about me and my humble paper. I still find your social insights valuable, and I’m always willing to pay for anything you can bring to me.”
pierresInformation.node.4: "While the details of their beliefs have been remarkably difficult to track down, I know two things about their views."
pierresInformation.node.3: Pierre sighs and mops the sweat from his brow with a severely stained handkerchief. “To be honest madame, I'm in a bit of a tough situation.”
pierresInformation.node.2: "It may shock you to learn that your Armand managed to keep some rather… opinionated company." Pierre says with the careful circumspection of someone severely downplaying the seriousness of a situation.
pierresInformation.node.1: “Now, I assume, you wish to know more about your beloved Armand, non?”
pierresInformation.node.0: Pierre claps his hands together in delight, “Madame, it appears that you have done me a great service! With this latest gossip, I can finally launch my most controversial social piece yet!”
pierresInformation.link.12: “But, of course Pierre! This has been a delight.”
pierresInformation.link.5: “If I’m your only real source, shouldn’t I be getting paid more?”
pierresInformation.link.4: “You have my condolences, Pierre. That sounds difficult.”
pierresInformation.link.1: “Before we get into that… why did you need me, specifically, to do this?”
rendezvousAtParcMonceauBearingGiftsOutfi: The Rendezvous
(Being exhausted has given you a credibility penalty)
(Being well rested has given you a credibility bonus!)
You're neither well rested, nor exhausted. Nothing is holding you back from being your most engaging self.
Unfortunately, you can feel the exhaustion set in as soon as you step out the door. Tonight is going to be a long night.
You're thankfully well rested for this particular event, so you manage to feel invigorated, and ready to take on whatever comes your way.
('Parc Monceau' is now an available rendezvous location)

This is your first time visiting the surreal landscape of Parc Monceau. The massive gardens are bustling with people, who are gasping and gawking at the many displays and costumed persons demonstrating the treasures of the world.

A few hours later, you realize that it's starting to get late, and the two of you depart together.

The two of you stick close together, floating from one exhibit to the next. In fact, you spend quite a bit of time in the Turkish tent ,where Madame Gazel has grown extremely enamored with the nargile, a water pipe used for smoking tobacco.
A few hours later, you realize that it's starting to get late, and the two of you depart together.

Still, the two of you go around the park together, and try to have a good time. For her part, Élisabeth is doing her best, but she still stops to grumble to herself whenever you encounter something that's a particularly egregious affront to the notions of good taste.
(You have gained a little favor with Madame Gazel)
Madame Gazel spends quite some time taking in the crowds and the bizarre structures of Parc Monceau. "Well, I must say, it's like nothing I've ever seen."
(You have lost a little favor with Élisabeth)
Élisabeth looks at the surreal landscape of Parc Monceau, then back at you before finally saying "I don't know, doesn't this place feel tacky to you?"
Turning her attention from you, she surveys your location.
"Oh, this is very pleasing." She says, looking at you through narrowed eyes as she slowly circles you like a panther. "You've done quite well."

Looking away from you, she surveys your location.

"You look nice." She says with a quick smile.
Ever since you arrived together, Madame Gazel has been standing far closer than the rules of politeness might allow. It's easy to forget how good she is at looming over people.

You return to the surreal landscape of Parc Monceau. The massive gardens are bustling with people, who are gasping and gawking at the many displays and costumed persons demonstrating the treasures of the world.

elisabethsInvitation.name: Elisabeth's Invitation
elisabethsInvitation.node.6: The letter goes on to describe a location where you could meet her.
elisabethsInvitation.node.5: You check her directions against your map. It might be possible to meet up with Élisabeth tonight.
elisabethsInvitation.node.4: ('La Dame Des Beaux-Arts' is now available to visit in the Paris map)
elisabethsInvitation.node.3: 'You mean a lot to me, and I just want to find the right way to say it. Bisous, - Élisabeth'
elisabethsInvitation.node.2: 'Chère Yvette, I know this doesn't come at a convenient time, but with things as they are in the streets, I don't think we'll see something resembling a convenient time for quite a while. I want to see you, and soon.'
elisabethsInvitation.node.1: You break the seal with a deft slice from your letter opener. The messy, nearly illegible handwriting is clearly Élisabeth's.
elisabethsInvitation.node.0: You notice that Camille has left a letter on your vanity. The wax seal is a deep royal purple, but there are also notice a tiny spatterings of oil paints at the corners of the paper.
theLadyOfFineArts.name: La Dame Des Beaux-Arts
theLadyOfFineArts.node.88: You know this place. This is the fountain square where you met when she was still searching for inspiration. This late at night, the square is practically abandoned. The sky is clear and the moon bathes everything in a pale glow.
theLadyOfFineArts.node.87: (The Bourgoeisie has moved towards the Crown by quite a bit)
theLadyOfFineArts.node.86: (The Military has moved towards the Crown by quite a bit)
theLadyOfFineArts.node.85: (The Church has moved towards the Crown by quite a bit)
theLadyOfFineArts.node.84: "What do you think? She keeps asking me, but I'm just a painter!"

theLadyOfFineArts.node.82: (You have gained some favor with Élisabeth)

theLadyOfFineArts.node.72: Silently, you part ways when you arrive near your home.
theLadyOfFineArts.node.71: An older drunk, stares at you with a disapproving frown.
theLadyOfFineArts.node.70: With a sigh, you look away, feigning deference until he feels satisfied and walks away with his minor triumph.
theLadyOfFineArts.node.69: You sit up straight, and stare right back at him. You stare as hard as you can, until, with a sneer, he departs. He spits on the sidewalk right before he turns a corner.
theLadyOfFineArts.node.68:
After a while, it feels... normal. It feels like how any two people should feel, while in love. Alone together on a moonlit night. 

It feels normal, and that fills you with a special kind of joy.
theLadyOfFineArts.node.67: That word echoes in your mind as your hand brushes the side of Élisabeth's face, tucking a stray lock over hair behind her ear, while she does the same to you. Like a taught thread, the need for discretion attempts to hold you back.
theLadyOfFineArts.node.65: To him, and to the rest of the world, you and Élisabeth are just two close friends. Anything closer would be worthy of disapproval, ridicule, even violence. So you hide your feelings, to make society more comfortable. To please the sensibilities of the drunk on the street.
theLadyOfFineArts.node.64: "I hate that we always have to hide, when we're together and well... I figured an empty courtyard might be the next best thing."
theLadyOfFineArts.node.62: The two of you walk together, in heavy silence. While you're sure it couldn't be longer than a few minutes, it feels like it stretches into eternity.
theLadyOfFineArts.node.61: "That's not what I expected, but it makes sense. If she encouraged the King to leave them alone, it could show that the Crown is willing to listen."
theLadyOfFineArts.node.60: "Yvette, is that where your allegiance really lies?"
theLadyOfFineArts.node.59: Eventually, she looks at you with shock and disgust. "The Revolution? You want me to tell my friend to go soft on the people that want to hurt and disempower her family?"
theLadyOfFineArts.node.57: "It wasn't. They wanted me to stop talking, so they could control the conversation. I've been giving them what they want."
theLadyOfFineArts.node.56: "The art critics, and those boors in L'Académie, they're the ones who hurt her! I let them blame me, until I blamed myself."
theLadyOfFineArts.node.55: "She told me that it was her favorite. That it was the best painting of her that anyone had ever done."
theLadyOfFineArts.node.54: After a long pause, she speaks again, her voice starting to crack "Do you know what Marie said to me?"
theLadyOfFineArts.node.53: "If I'm to be happy, I must stop letting fools drag my name through the mud."
theLadyOfFineArts.node.52: "Lately, I've been considering some of the things you've said to me. About my critics, and how hard it is to ignore all of their remarks."
theLadyOfFineArts.node.51: "For the first time in a long time, I think I'm really alright."
theLadyOfFineArts.node.50: She glances down at your hands. "Verbally, that is."
theLadyOfFineArts.node.49: With triumphant thoughts of the evening's machinations marching through your head, you go upstairs, already planning what you'll write in your journal before bed.
theLadyOfFineArts.node.48: With sweet thoughts of the evening's details dancing through your head, you go upstairs, already planning what you'll write in your journal before bed.
theLadyOfFineArts.node.47: Burdened with heavy thoughts, you trudge upstairs, already planning what you'll write in your journal before bed.
theLadyOfFineArts.node.46: "I'm sorry to hear that, madame." Camille replies glumly. "If it helps, I've prepared your room, just the way you like it."
theLadyOfFineArts.node.45: "I don't know what that means, but it sounds lovely!" Camille replies, full of enthusiasm. "I've prepared your room, just the way you like it."
theLadyOfFineArts.node.44: "I'm glad to hear that, madame!" Camille chirps, her cheeks flushing slightly. "I've prepared your room, just the way you like it."
theLadyOfFineArts.node.42: At home, Camille opens the door on the first knock. "Bonsoir, Madame!"
theLadyOfFineArts.node.41: The two of you spend some more time together by the fountain, making little jokes and tossing pebbles into the water. It's nice to be together, but eventually you have to part ways.
theLadyOfFineArts.node.40: The sound of a throat clearing snaps you back to reality, and you can feel Elisabeth freeze like a statue in your arms.
theLadyOfFineArts.node.39: An older man staggers by, watching you with the glazed over, uncomprehending expression of a man who's drank beyond his limits. He makes no attempt to hide his staring, and in that moment, your need for discretion feels justified.
theLadyOfFineArts.node.38: The two of you sit close together, at the fountain's edge. You hold hands and watch the moon. She holds onto you with such a tightness, like a sailor thrown overboard, holding onto a rope, trying not to drown.
theLadyOfFineArts.node.37: Despite the risks, your lips meet hers and they are warm. They are soft. Her hand traces up your spine and it feels right. Your fingers entwine themselves in her hair.
theLadyOfFineArts.node.36: "I understand." She says with a smile, tinged with regret.
theLadyOfFineArts.node.34: She flushes, and her voice gets quieter. "I also thought the moonlight was romantic."
theLadyOfFineArts.node.33: "Whenever I've passed through here, this square tended to be empty around now." She explains, gesturing at the open courtyard.
theLadyOfFineArts.node.32:
As your mind twists and turns, trying to calculate the political consequences of that little suggestion, you realize that this isn't your normal route home. You must have been too lost in the conversation to notice. 

You glance up and down the deserted and streets and wonder where you're actually going.
theLadyOfFineArts.node.31: "Well, that makes sense. It's good to stick with the people who've supported you in the past, and his Majesty has always been able to count on the Holy Father, the Pope."
theLadyOfFineArts.node.30: "Well, it's hard to argue with that logic. When danger grows close, you generally want the people with guns on your side."
theLadyOfFineArts.node.29: "Well, it would be easy to get Marie to understand their concerns. As an art dealer, my husband is more Bourgeoisie than anything else."
theLadyOfFineArts.node.28: Elisabeth pauses to think about this for a while, tapping her finger against her chin.
theLadyOfFineArts.node.27: Élisabeth pauses to think about this for a while, tapping her finger against her chin. "The Bourgeoisie? Really?"
theLadyOfFineArts.node.26: Elisabeth pauses to think about this for a while, tapping her finger against her chin. "The Military? Really?"
theLadyOfFineArts.node.25: Élisabeth pauses to think about this for a while, tapping her finger against her chin. "The Church? Really?"
theLadyOfFineArts.node.23: "Ever since we started talking again, Marie's been asking my opinion on all sorts of things. She feels like the Crown doesn't have many friends left in France, and doesn't know who they should be reaching out to."
theLadyOfFineArts.node.22: "She reaches out and loops her arm through your own. The two of you walk, arm in arm for a while.
theLadyOfFineArts.node.21: The conversation dies down for a minute, while you both recompose your thoughts.
theLadyOfFineArts.node.20: "You're free to think that, if you like, but I've already made up my mind."
theLadyOfFineArts.node.19: She smiles at you. "Please, take the compliment. You don't need to be so modest."
theLadyOfFineArts.node.18: Looking deep into your eyes, she says. "You really have."
theLadyOfFineArts.node.17: "... and well, you've been a big part of that."
theLadyOfFineArts.node.16: "Realizing this, it's made everything better. Even my paintings are coming easier than before. I'm actually excited about my next three patrons."
theLadyOfFineArts.node.15: "These last few weeks, I've been getting better, and one question kept coming back to me."
theLadyOfFineArts.node.14: "To be honest, I think that I was troubled for so long that I forget what being comfortable with myself actually felt like."
theLadyOfFineArts.node.13: "And why not? I have many clients, I'm essentially the personal painter of her Majesty the Queen, and I'm a full member of L'Académie Royale de Peinture et de Sculpture. I'm not even forty years old and I've accomplished more than most will in their entire lives."
theLadyOfFineArts.node.12: "No, it's not that. I've just realized that all my time spent feigning indifference has been a mistake." She pauses to brush away an errant tear. "Indifference isn't working. I need to start defending myself."
theLadyOfFineArts.node.11: "I started talking to Marie again, and she told me that my portrait was her favorite. That it was the best painting of her that anyone had ever done."
theLadyOfFineArts.node.10: "That's the problem. I kept telling myself that letting my detractors say anything they please about me was dignity."
theLadyOfFineArts.node.9: Élisabeth favors you with a big, happy grin. "I knew you'd like that."
theLadyOfFineArts.node.8:
A few tears roll down her cheeks, but Élisabeth doesn't seem to notice. 

"All this time I thought I was a monster, but I'd never hurt my friend. In fact, I gave her exactly what she wanted."
theLadyOfFineArts.node.7: "Well, I started talking to Marie again and I tried to apologize for embarrassing her with that portrait."
theLadyOfFineArts.node.6: "Why should I sit idly by while fools drag my name through the mud?"
theLadyOfFineArts.node.5: "I tried to think that rebuking my detractors would only embolden them, but that dignity only works for lords and ladies. They have titles and privileges to protect them. I don't."
theLadyOfFineArts.node.2: "I think I've been going about this all wrong."
theLadyOfFineArts.node.1: "About how I've tried to keep them at bay by feigning indifference."
theLadyOfFineArts.node.0: When you meet up with Élisabeth, you walk together in silence for some time. However, you notice that she's walking closer to you than usual, and generally seems more upbeat.
theLadyOfFineArts.link.93: "Well, it sounds like they should focus on finding some allies."
theLadyOfFineArts.link.92: "Has she considered taking a softer stance against the Revolutionaries?"
theLadyOfFineArts.link.43: "Are you sure it's a good idea to dignify them with a response?"
theLadyOfFineArts.link.30: "Things didn't go as well as I'd hoped."
theLadyOfFineArts.link.29: "It's been a productive evening, my ambitions draw closer."
theLadyOfFineArts.link.28: "Camille, it was filled with the best kind of romance."
theLadyOfFineArts.link.24: "That's really sweet, but I don't think we should risk it."
theLadyOfFineArts.link.19: "The Bourgeoisie are the ones paying for everything, try to keep them happy."
theLadyOfFineArts.link.18: "Has she considered the Military? You can't rule France without an army."
theLadyOfFineArts.link.17: "What about the Church? They've always supported the Crown in the past."
theLadyOfFineArts.link.13: "This is your revelation, I've just been observing."
theLadyOfFineArts.link.6: "Are you sure it's a good idea to dignify them with a response?"
theLadyOfFineArts.link.2: "Oh God, what happened? Do you need me to slap someone? Because, I'm ready."
theLadyOfFineArts.link.0: "... and what do you think now?"
parismap.description.missionTheLadyOfFin: Élisabeth has requested to meet with you. Normally, she’s nervous about being seen close to you in public, but this is unusually forward of her. What could this be about?
clandestineInvitations.name: Clandestine Invitations
clandestineInvitations.node.7: In fact, you could visit him at any time.
clandestineInvitations.node.6: ('Clandestine Meetings' are now available to visit in the Paris map)
clandestineInvitations.node.5: Reaching the end, you put down the letter, and consider this unexpected opportunity. You pick up and flip through the meticulous notes in your journal, and quickly deduce his home address.
clandestineInvitations.node.4: 'You've been so generous with your time these last few weeks, that I would like to repay you with some proper hospitality. Mes salutations respectueuses, An Anonymous Lover'
clandestineInvitations.node.3: Chère Yvette, If I know you as well as I think I do, you've already figured out who wrote this. While I cannot risk too many specifics, it appears that I'll be alone in my chambers for the foreseeable future, as all my fellow occupants will be absent due to a commitment in the countryside.'
clandestineInvitations.node.2: However, this mystery is resolved the moment you open the letter, and recognize Ludovico's handwriting. It's certainly well practiced, but he still puts some of the accent marks in the wrong places.
clandestineInvitations.node.1: You pick up and examine the outside of the letter, but it bears neither a sigil, nor a name. It's simply sealed with a blob of unstamped wax.
clandestineInvitations.node.0: Waking up with a yawn, you notice that Camille seems to have left a letter on your night stand.
